Reviews.Title: “dreamercon@yahoo.com”
Reviews.Author: dreamercon
Reviews.Content: We booked a room at the Comfort Inn because it was one of very few hotels that offered two beds in the same room. Our experience at the hotel has been very disappointing. The hotel did not have our room available and only had a room available with one bed, despite the fact that we were charged extra for choosing a room with two beds. The receptionist refused to let me talk to her manager over this and told me that I should have called the hotel ahead of time to confirm that the specific room had been available. Our room was extremely noisy. The heating was really loud, and we could not sleep at night with the fan on. And it was freezing cold when we turned it off. Moreover, there is a night club right next to the hotel that got pretty loud. And finally, our room was next to the dining area, and we were awoken at 6 am by noise from other guests and staff. While our room had two telephones, a TV and a coffee-maker, it didn't have a closet or any other place to hang our clothes! Moreover, there was a four foot-high pile of trash right in front of the hotel entrance. Terrible experience, stay away!

Reviews.Title: “Lots of Space and Great Service”
Reviews.Author: DrBong
Reviews.Content: I met up with some friends in NYC for the weekend and booked a Jr Suite at Comfort Inn Times Square and was amazed at how easy it was to access when I drove in from PA. There is parking across the street and they gave me a discount when I had the hotel stamp my ticket. There is a small lobby for check in and a larger waiting area in the basement and that worked out well b/c we all came into the city at different times. Our room was HUGE compared to others I had stayed in while visiting NYC (still small overall but that is how things are in NYC) There was a pull out sofa, 2 TVs, large bathroom,mini fridge, and microwave. Shavana at the front desk was a great hostess and made sure we had everything we needed. I would stay again for sure!!

Reviews.Title: “very small, cubicle”
Reviews.Author: mpsofia2002
Reviews.Content: Some friends and i took a small vacation to NYC for a few days just for leisure and it was awsome. Staying at this hotel was ok. the staff was very friendly and helpful. the location is great. walking distance to restaurants, bars and shopping. Timesquares main attractions are a few blocks over so it was great. one downside though is that its right next door to a nite club so wen u get home late at night there is drunk people right outside your hotels front entrance door. kinda scary for 2 girls from texas traveling alone. also the rooms are tiny. would have been perfect had we not had luggage but of course we did. there was no room to even walk about the room to get dressed. we did ask for a bigger room but there was no availability. there is 4 rooms to a floor and the corner rooms are smaller than the other 2. the front desk attendant was very helpful and even tried to switch our rooms to accomodate us but with no luck. she also mentioned that most rooms in most hotels are the same size. i guess NYC hotels build up instead of out and that is why thier rooms are so narrow. Also before i forget the AC/heater unit is right below the window and the bed is against the window covering the unit so the AC/heater blows directly to the bed. kinda sucked. i visited another hotel with a friend and it was just as small so good luck. travel light. Other than that it was good. there is a concierge in the lobby ready to book your tours if your interested. we took several tours. i recommend the Top of the Rock tour. it took us every where we wanted to visit. statue of liberty, central park, soho, Rockfeller Center, etc. it was great and very inexpensive. Good Luck. Hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “The only hotel I will stay at.”
Reviews.Author: MichelleluvsNYC
Reviews.Content: After visiting NYC for 20 years and staying at various hotels, I am so glad I found this Comfort Inn last year. Within walking distance to Penn Station & Times Square. A ton of places to eat nearby as well. Modern rooms, very clean & the staff are super nice. Great complimentary breakfast. All in all, you can't go wrong!

Reviews.Title: “Friendliest Hotel in NYC”
Reviews.Author: Ann F
Reviews.Content: Our theatre company holds auditions in NYC frequently, so we've stayed at many hotels there over the past 20 years. This one was heads and shoulders above any other hotel we've stayed at!! The staff was SO friendly, the rooms were well-appointed and clean (although small but, then again, what reasonably priced hotel in NYC doesn't have small rooms?), parking was conveniently located directly across the street, they accommodated every request (from early check-in, to storing bags 5 hours past their normal cut-off period - in fact, when I offered the hotel staff person a small tip for the luggage accommodation, she politely refused and asked me to just write a positive review of the hotel!), and price could not be beat. The only minor negative comment is that the fan for the room heater went on and off frequently throughout the night - finally just turned it off. We've already recommended the hotel to others and will most definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location for Times Square”
Reviews.Author: hrcalso
Reviews.Content: I went to Times Square. This place is at 8th & 39th. Times Sq is at 43rd & 8th. Empire St building is at 33rd & 5th. The subway is at 43rd & 7th. Hard Rock Cafe is at 43rd & 7th. Madison Sq Garden is at 31st & 7th. Very good location to walk to what you would like to see in the area. I took the subway to Statue of Lib and it took 20 min and cost 2.2 one way. The trip to the Lady/Ellis Island cost $13. It stopped at both places. Lines were not bad, but I thought longer because it is Feb. You could not go into her unless you paid for tour. I parked right across from hotel. Cost was $40 with hotel stamp. Hotel had a regular cont breakfast items with a waffle maker and chaffing dish with eggs and sausages(self serv). They gave me a excellent map to show the area. They had a person to help you for sightseeing. Cost of room(206) thru AAA, total was 240 with all the taxes. I did find after I booked that you can go thru comfort web site, book and pay in advance for 186 base rate. Driving into NY was not bad. GPS lost satellite a couple of times but came back up. Side streets were jammed with delivery trucks. There is NO parking to speak of on any of the streets(unless you get real lucky and catch someone pulling out). Leaving was a charm. Went to the first light,left 2 1/2 blocks down was Lincoln Tunnel into Jersey.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Location, & Staff!”
Reviews.Author: Shreeps Z
Reviews.Content: Feb 2012 I'm an Atlanta, GA-based singer/songwriter that traveled to NY in February for a show. I expected that other than crashing on couches throughout the week that it would be impossible to find reasonable lodging that didn't gross me (& my traveling companion) out. Thankfully, we stumbled into this Comfort Inn! Found it on hotels.com and gave it a go. Before I could even get the words out of my mouth, the receptionist Shivani had us booked into our room at the advertised rate! No hassle like our previous hotel! Also, my cousin who was with me had his dog with him & the staff was very kind in acomodating our puppy. Not the easiest thing in NY! So for the 3 days we were there, we had a great rate, a great location (off of Times Square enough to avoid getting immediately sucked into the crowds), & great service (the staff was friendly & professional throughout our stay!) The management even allowed us to use the lounge/cafeteria area to do a dry run for my show. Not every place would ok with that! The one big con of the location are the slow internet access (don't expect to be streaming videos). So to sum up, our stay was a memorable one for the right reasons! A decent room at an excellent (by NY standards) price in a good location! If you're traveling through NY for a couple days, I would recommend this place! Don't expect the lush & lavishness of a more expensive NY hotel! Just be glad to find something circa or under $100 that doesn't make you regret that you stayed there! This location will be on my list for future visits! Read some of the other reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Value and great location!!”
Reviews.Author: ericsf
Reviews.Content: Normally I am not one to venture to hotels below 3 stars because frankly the quality level can be all over the charts. But on my recent visit to NYC I came upon this particular comfort inn online and a great rate for NYC. I was highly impressed! The hotel is in a very convenient location, right near times square, walking distance to Chelsea and everything you need is right in the area. The rooms are nicely decorated and comfortable. Free wireless which is always a plus and a free hot breakfast. Overall for NYC hotels this was an amazing deal. Definitely will be staying here again next time I am in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Good Price+Good Location=Good Value”
Reviews.Author: MiamiGringo
Reviews.Content: Really not much to add to the other positive reviews. The location is great, the rooms are well appointed, the hotel is clean and efficient and the staff is professional. Considering the price I paid, I'm even more impressed by the value. Definitely a great find.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, decent price”
Reviews.Author: Lois G
Reviews.Content: Mom's first trip to NYC, so it had to be done RIGHT. I chose this hotel because of its closeness to Times Square and theatres. We weren't disappointed. The hotel staff was super-friendly and helpful. I expected a tiny room, based on others' reviews -- the double room we had on the 2nd floor was larger than I expected. More than enough room to move about comfortably. Spacious bathroom (although the bathroom didn't get any heat -- BRR!) that was clean, had plenty of hot water and excellent water pressure. I've seen luke-warm reviews about their continental breakfast. Word to the wise: go early. The food is good, warm, and there's an excellent selection. Seating is super-limited though and it gets crowded quick especially if there are kids running about. Free coffee is available ALL DAY which is a super-nice feature. The location was prime. We took the Lincoln Tunnel into the city and upon exiting the Tunnel, we were practically at the hotel's doorstep. AWESOME. We were only a couple blocks from everything we wanted to see. The hotel felt very safe and was well-kept. Only 2 "negatives" ... 1) There is no Comfort Inn parking garage. There's an Icon garage across the street and it's about $40 for 24 hours. Super-convenient, super-fast, super-friendly. But it's $40 for 24 hours. Welcome to New York! and 2) Occasionally a strange sound would come from the air vent in our bathroom. I called the front desk and they said there was something about air pockets in the vents when it gets really cold outside. We only heard it twice, and not for any long duration. HUGE "positive" ... I think that's one of the most comfortable hotel beds I've ever slept in. I was tempted to ask them what kind of mattress it was, and go buy one for home. :)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value and Experience”
Reviews.Author: Jim B
Reviews.Content: We made this visit at the peak Christmas - New Year's season and were very pleased with the hotel. Very comfortable bed, clean rooms. Staff went out of their way to please. (Sophie was a jewel.) Great breakfast, even under very busy usage. Concierge was helpful. For the price, it was more than we expected.

Reviews.Title: “weekend adventure”
Reviews.Author: stevenroe120666
Reviews.Content: Very convenient to main hub of entertainment. Excellent staff with very clean rooms. Although quite small rooms it is my understanding this is typical NY city. Rooms confortable and staff gladly held all bags after checkout until we were ready to leave NY.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, quiet, clean”
Reviews.Author: SS S
Reviews.Content: This hotel was not $350 like the one review said. It was very economical--room is small but clean and comfortable. So close to both Penn Square Station and Port Authority. Great variety of breakfast foods. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “decent, not cheap”
Reviews.Author: liltravlr
Reviews.Content: Stayed here Oct'11. Good room, quiet, nice little continental breakfast included. Superb location at Times Square, so chose to pay astronomical $350 for a night instead of lots of taxi fares. Worth it if you have little time and want to be close to everything cool. Walked to O'Lunney's Irish Pub, all around 34th and Times Square, and a few steps to home.NYC hotels have got to be the most expensive I've ever found, as this was the cheapest decent hotel in the best area (I never usually pay over $100/night anywhere!) Friendly staff, if you need an airport transfer, make sure to tell them when you arrive or you will miss it!

Reviews.Title: “breakfast and location”
Reviews.Author: elin h
Reviews.Content: i stayed at this hotel august -10 with my 2 friends. The hotel has a very good location. we could go shopping and then go back to the hotel with the bags and then keep on shopping.. the breakfast was really good for such a small hotel. not always any avalible tables (they only had like 5 of them) at the little breakfast area, but we took our breakfast up to the room if we could'nt get any seats. the rooms were like standard hotel rooms. we had 2 queen beds which made the room look very small. not very much space to walk on. Although, we were not in new york to stay at the hotel. It was for sleeping and putting all the things.. kind of! the reception staff was always nice and helpful! very good service!

Reviews.Title: “Happy with this place”
Reviews.Author: silverscreen76
Reviews.Content: Great location, plenty nearby. The rooms were pleasant, quiet and very comfortable. Staff were quite nice to deal with and there was discounted parking across the street. I would definitely book there again.

Reviews.Title: “A most a bargain.”
Reviews.Author: Jolynn33
Reviews.Content: Conveniently located just a few short blocks from Times Square and the Theatre district, in the heart of the fabric world of New York City this was a pleasant surprise. An easy walk to Herald Square and Macys as well, a hotel with clean, comfortable rooms and an excellent, professional staff at a price that won't break the bank was quite a find. The room was small but nicely appointed with a large bathroom trimmed out with granite and marble. If you can, ask for a room away from the street. There was a protest against a neighboring property and the noise was an unwelcome wake-up a bit earlier than I might have liked. Take advantage of the validated parking right next door and the wonderful concierg service. Also, it was terrific to be able to leave our luggage there after checkout so we could make the most of the entire day after leaving the hotel. As an aside, I have stayed at much more luxurious hotels and this is the first with fitted sheets!!! What an unexpected pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: PatriciaVermont
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this NYC hotel 10/2011 and had a great experience. The front desk was very friendly. New person training, so a few glitches there, but nothing very inconvenient. The room was no smaller than some other NYC hotels and it was well appointed and very clean. Two adult and 2 teens had plenty of space for sleeping and getting ready to go out for the day. Breakfast was great, small area, but plenty of food and good hot coffee and we took it to our room and all was good. Noise was not an issue and the club next door was not a disturbance (very discreet). Yes, it would be nice if there were not a large pile of full trash bags in front of the club next door, but not much the hotel can do about that.

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: nymph2106
Reviews.Content: I had actually mistakenly booked a room at this hotel for two nights for a quick weekend trip with the family, thinking it was the OTHER Comfort Inn in Times Square, which has better reviews. It was too late to cancel the reservation after I realised my mistake, since I had opted for a non-refundable rate. Was a tad worried after reading the reviews here, but it all worked out pretty well. First off, let me say that I paid about US$250 a night for the room with two double beds for FOUR people, which is actually really cheap for the Times Square area in Manhattan. The room was small (even more so when you have four people), but at least it was clean and served its purpose (we needed only a place to sleep in and were never around during the day). The bathroom door didn't lock properly (no biggie) but that was the only problem we encountered. Shower worked fine, and water temperature and pressure were great. We stayed here over a weekend, and it was hard getting to sleep on Saturday night because the hotel is right next to a male strip club and the club's patrons were outside making a lot of noise way after midnight. Then again, we had a room on the second floor facing the street, so perhaps getting a room on the other side of the hotel might have helped. Breakfast was nothing much to shout about - pastries, juice, sausages - and the dining area was small and crowded (you might have to take food back to your room). The reception area is small and there is usually only one person at the counter, which means you might have to wait in line for a while. The check-in process took a while, but the staff was courteous and friendly, and gave us all the information (breakfast hours, wifi password) without us asking. You'd be hard pressed to find a hotel room at this rate around the same area in Manhattan. So while this wasn't a great hotel, I'd still recommend it for a short stay if you don't intend to stay in your room all the time (and who does in New York?) based on the fact that it's very affordable. If you are there on honeymoon and hoping for a romantic time, it's probably better to look elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value at a great location”
Reviews.Author: RexT
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 night in Sept-Oct 2011 at this hotel and were very pleased with it. No, it is not a 4 star hotel, it is a Comfort Inn, so it is not fancy or luxurious, etc. We found it clean, efficient, modern and entirely adequate for our stay. We reserved a mini-suite which was fine, space-wise. Although we were on the 19th floor, the 2 elevators seemed surprisingly sufficient. The bed was very comfortable. We inspected thoroughly for bed bugs before settling in, and found no evidence anywhere. TV was limited; just a few stations and the reception sub-standard (non HD on flat screen TVs?). Free wireless, which worked well. As stated in other reviews, the breakfast area was quite cramped and the lobby small. The good news is that there is indeed a breakfast provided! 39th St is a bit "gritty" but not too much so; really felt like it was part of NYC. Finally --- the location was fantastic. Just a minute or three walk to just about anywhere - Times Square, Penn Station, whatever. Also, our windows were openable; it was nice to get some fresh air. All in all, we had excellent value for money. There were NO substantial weaknesses with this hotel. I was a bit anxious about a midtown Comfort Inn but this was without foundation --- it more than met our expectations at a reasonable price (for Manhattan).

Reviews.Title: “mediocre”
Reviews.Author: Daniel S
Reviews.Content: This is a cheap hotel by Manhattan standards, but it's not as good as, say, a standard American motel room. The shower couldn't maintain its water temperature, freezing and scalding the user alternatively. The TV reception was bad, odd in a city where cable is widely used. The rooms are OK and the staff friendly and the location is great.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Vincent B
Reviews.Content: We stayed in mid-August and yes the rooms are small and the breakfast area is small but for the price we paid, I'd go back. The location was 5 minutes from Times Square, close to subway etc. Hotel staff were very friendly and accomodating. We arrived 3 hours before check-in and Skylar (hope spelling is correct) was very helpful and got us into our room with no delay. We were able to get out and enjoy the city without dragging our luggage. Even when we checked out, the hotel staff stored our luggage for about 6 hours. Again, we were able to still go out and enjoy the sights while our luggage was stored. What they do for you outside the room counts as well. Overall a great value!

Reviews.Title: “great value for the location”
Reviews.Author: s3cr3t
Reviews.Content: for the price in that area, I thought it was a good deal. The Guy at the front desk was really nice. I did find a few crumbs in the room though. (didn't complain about it) overall, it wasn't too bad.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel for the price but very small”
Reviews.Author: jcm68
Reviews.Content: We planned a trip to NYC to see the Book of Mormon and decided to stay in Times Square to be close to the theater district. The hotel is a good value and in a decent location (if you are okay with the crowds in Times Square) but the rooms are very small. It's clean and the staff is professional if not overly friendly. Other reviewers commented on the small breakfast dining area - that is a legitmate complaint. It is far too small to accomodate all hotel guests during the breakfast hours. My suggestion is to add another hour to the breakfast time so fewer guests need to be in the area at one time. With that said, the complimentary breakfast was a nice plus. Another thing I found odd is that rooms do not have washcloths as part of the bathroom towel sets. There a nightclub next door to the hotel but we were on the 19th floor and not bothered by noise. Overall, a decent place to stay for the price especially if you aren't planning on spending much time in the room and really just need a place to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Far from the best, but ok!”
Reviews.Author: 1Sabrina9
Reviews.Content: I booked an organize trip with a company here in Montreal and stayed at the Comfort Inn from August 5th to 7th 2011. It's not the best hotel I've ever been to, but it was fine! It is located about 4 blocks from Times Square which is really good! If you like to walk, you can get to 5th Avenue or Central Park walking, or else it's about 10$ for the taxi. But, the street on which is located this hotel is really ugly and dirty. It's located just next door of a male strip club, you get the picture... Haha! IThe room was pretty and clean, but indeed a little small. It was noisy, but the air conditioner was hiding the outside noises. The staff was nice, they greeted us when we walked in or out. The hotel also offers a breakfast buffet, which is basic (toast, eggs, sausage, bacon, muffins, coffee, ect) but fine. It is really small and not a lot of people can eat there at once, but we took the food and went to eat in our room. once, we arrived at 7h30 (opens at 7h) and a lot of things were missing (food, cups, ect) and it was a little long for the girl to replace it with new one, she was alone so I don't blame her, but they should anticipate a little more... I think the price is a little high for the hotel quality, but you're in New York so... Overall, it was a good experience and I do recommend it! Don't expect too much and it will be fine! Have a nice trip!

Reviews.Title: “Decent, but prefer the other Comfort Inn”
Reviews.Author: emisch
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Comfort Inn Times Square and Comfort Inn Times Square South. No question the non-south one is better. The hotel and rooms are clean. Location is right off 8th Ave and a couple blocks south of the Times Square area. However, at night those last two blocks can seem a bit dicey. Also, to breakfast area is way too small for the number of guests they have. It was a struggle to maneuver around to even grab some food, much less to find a chair to sit and eat it. There are only 3-4 rooms per floors so you may be on the 16th floor and trying to carry cereal back to your room to eat it! Overall, if the non-south Comfort Inn is within $25 of the South one, I'd pay more for the non-south.

Reviews.Title: “Fire hazard”
Reviews.Author: mrs_seng
Reviews.Content: We got to the hotel early, before check in time. Skylar at the desk took our luggages and stored it for us, which was wonderful so we don't have to explore while hauling our belongings. We'd came back at check in time, but ended up waiting about another half hour just to get a room. The room wasn't ready yet. The front desk staffs were a bit unorganized. I won't blame them for that because there was an elderly lady wanting to switch rooms with another member. So they had to move the rooms around. The concierge gal wore flip flops to work, which was unprofessional. She'd just sat there and read her book. She didn't even acknowledged us or asked if we needed help with anything. The lobby was super small! Wow, felt like I was in a 3rd world country trying to check in. Again, spaces are limited in NY and they shouldn't be accountable for that. They did not have a business center or a work out room. Only 4 rooms on each floor. Hallways were super crowded. The housekeepers left their carts in the hallway which made it difficult for us to drag our luggages to get to our room. Talk about fire hazards! I guess in NY, they don't take that too seriously. The only good thing about this hotel is you get 2 free water bottles daily.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, good service, great location”
Reviews.Author: MumTraveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as a family July 2011. We had two rooms, one twin and one king size. The hotel could not get us rooms on the same floor, and apologised for that, but it was not a problem. As per normal New York hotels, the rooms are small, but well designed to use the space efficiently. Everything there that you need, hairdryer, desk space and lamp, safe, etc. More clothes hanging space would be nice but I understand the space limitations. The rooms were clean and well kept - I was wary of bedbugs after the reports on NY hotels, but no sign of them here. Contrary to some of the reports on this theme, we found the staff polite and very helpful. Front desk checked in for me and printed me a boarding pass - I tried first at the concierge (who is not hotel staff), she didn't want to do anything for me other than direct me to an internet cafe some blocks away. Staff were happy to help us store our luggage before and after check in. Blocked toilets seems to be a recurring theme here, ours was blocked but it was unblocked right away, and no further problems. The one negative comment I would have is the size of the breakfast room, which I can see would be difficult for the hotel to change! We intended to take advantage of the free breakfast but couldn't bear to squeeze into the crowded room, and the bedrooms are really too small to take food into, so we treated ourselves to a nearby diner. Location is great, we walked most places from here and got the Metro when going further afield. We'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but staff is hit and miss”
Reviews.Author: Flight17
Reviews.Content: This hotel's location is perfect for first-timers in New York City, as it is within walking distance of Times Square, Fifth Avenue and Central Park. The hotel itself is in a strange building, with 20 floors and only four rooms on each floor. The room was small, but clean and with all the amenities you need: a television, a safety deposit box and both wired and wireless internet connection (although the connection was awfully slow at times). Bottles with drinking water was supplied every day, and continental breakfast was included in the price. The only two negative things about the hotel are the following: - A tiny breakfast room with only a few tables. - The staff was definitely hit and miss. The people at the front desk and the girls at the concierge service and housekeeping were usually very friendly, but certain other members of the staff were a bit moody and seemed generally unhappy and would snap when I asked them questions. I will gladly recommend this hotel - just beware of the attitude of some of the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good accommodation at a great price”
Reviews.Author: j_emmerson
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed staying at the Comfort Inn Times Square South. Not a plush luxury hotel, but certainly adequate for anyone just needing clean, comfortable accommodation and not wanting to spend a lot of money for a bed. Rooms were sufficient in size, bathrooms were in good shape and clean and the beds were extremely comfortable. No major problems. Check in was quick. Staff very friendly. Had to ask for a couple things (blow dryer, extra toilet paper, shampoo) and the items were sent to our room without delay. Quick walk (5 minutes) to Times Square, subway system (less than 5 minutes), under 15 minutes to Empire State Building, Macy's, Penn Station. The only drawback was that a nightclub is operating next door and the patrons line up on the sidewalk, but the bouncers keep it fairly orderly. No noise issues when inside our rooms (16th floor), except for air conditioner which was a little loud -- but VERY effective (which was good since it was 92+ and humid outside every day). So, nothing "fancy," just good value.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, however no follow up on refund after toilet overflowing in bathroom”
Reviews.Author: Suzanne_NL
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel in the evening after a 10 hour flight and after being ripped off by a cabdriver (only go for yellow cabs and skip the lincoln towncar, that cost us $170 from the airport to the hotel). At night the street itself looked deserted, despite the location being near times square. The room we got was ok at first sight, altough we got a room with two queen beds instead of a king size bed. We figures we could deal with that in the morning. Within the first 30 minutes of us in the room the toilet overflowed while my fiancee was in the shower, leaving the bathroom floor covered in..well you can guess. I went down to the reception and asked if we could get another room as this was not acceptable. The hotel was fully booked and the receptionist did not seem very interested, he defenitely did not offer any solutions (there was no plumber available nor was any clean-up offered). I had to ask for towels to be brought up so we could cover the floor and asked where we could use the bathroom during the night if we needed one. I was informed that we could go down the breakfast area and use the toilet over there (which was about 10 floors down). The towels were delivered quickly. Of course I had to use the bathroom during the night (being jetlagged and all) so I had to get dressed again in the middle of the night, go down to the breakfast area in a dimly lit hotel and then get back up to the room again. Very uncomfortable. The next day we were moved to another room, ad the staff present were kind enough to have us check out the room first. The room we received on the 18th floor was much better (and also had the kingsize bed we had reservations for). All in all, we were happy with that but obviously we wanted some compensation for the first night. We talked to the general manager David and he offered a refund for our last night. He would deal wih Expedia (we booked via them). We were happy with that arrangement and the friendly service. However, the compensation never came. We sent a couple of e-mails after our return and tried calling, however we never heard back. Despite the otherwise pleasant stay, we would not recommend this hotel to others because of this.

Reviews.Title: “Bad hotel with even worse service!!!”
Reviews.Author: LOZ1217
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for ONE HOUR and are now in the process of trying to get our money refunded. The hotel itself is very dated, dirty and dumpy. I will simply LIST the drawbacks, as describing in detail would take pages: outside door handle to room 504 half missing, door didn't open properly and when it did, it caught inside on the bathroom door handle, internet not working, room was DIRTY - beds looked slept in - we wondered if it had been cleaned, toilet required 4 flushes, A/C was not "cold", rather just air blowing out. While I was at the front desk, there were 3 calls from other rooms about maintenance issues, a young boy who came down to tell the front desk that his mother had called about an overflowing toilet but no help had arrived, and two other guests were there complaining and trying to get help with the internet. We may have been able to tolerate the non-internet deficiencies if Skylar, at the front desk, was polite and if he had been willing to honor the company's 100% satisfaction guarantee. When we discovered the internet was not working from our room ("out of range" error) we asked if we could be moved to a room closer to the internet router and Skylar said "NO." He told us that it was a "Sunday and the internet signal is just low" (WHAT???) and to come to the lobby with our laptop and work there. I explained that both of my daughters are taking online college courses and needed in room internet to sit tests and Skylar responded RUDELY that we should just come to the lobby. In desperation, we tried the lobby and the internet did not work there either. We came to find out that the internet was not working in the entire hotel. Skylar's rudeness and unwillingness to honor Choice Hotel's satisfaction guarantee was the straw that broke the camel's back. We asked to check out and not be charged for the 3 nights we had booked. We were allowed to check out, but Skylar said he could not refund the the $800+ we were charged and that we would have to take it up with the manager (who was not available). We made the choice to leave and walk one block over to the Staybridge Suites where we were greeted with a smile, treated with respect and got a fabulous room. CHOICE HOTELS should be embarrassed by the Comfort Inn on W 39th and by the way guests are being treated by the hotel staff. (I understand that each hotel is operated independently, but the brand is still being represented).

Reviews.Title: “Evelyn at the front desk deserves a raise.”
Reviews.Author: LinFlin
Reviews.Content: This is my first review, which is prompted because I had to say how wonderful Evelyn at the front desk treated us during our stay. Every request or problem we had was resolved by her to our satisfaction, and she was always so pleasant! Our room had two double beds and it was still pretty roomy compared to rooms at other hotels. The location is pretty much perfect. A main subway is right around the corner, and you can walk to most of the big midtown attractions. We did not eat breakfast in the hotel because it's just too crowded. The room was very clean but I was not crazy about housekeeping. Since my daughter plans to attend college in New York, I am sure we will be staying here again many more times.

Reviews.Title: “A good stay overall”
Reviews.Author: CMSC
Reviews.Content: Stayed there mid-July. We just needed a room to sleep, after visiting NYC and walking about 12 hrs/ day. Room is small, I guess expected for a hotel in the middle of NYC. Clean overall, had good sound proof of the room. 2 bottles water and coffee in the room- but they have coffee for breakfast (included), so we did not use the room-coffee maker. Breakfast room small, but adequate (we went down to eat at 7.20 am, and it was not crowded. Nice people at the front desk. Good value for the money. Parking is not included, they offer some discount at a parking about 1 block away, but it's not their own parking place. Great location, very close to Times Square. Would go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good, the bad and the ugly”
Reviews.Author: Jean_Valjean
Reviews.Content: I really wanted to like this hotel. The day crew was very helpful at check-in so you like them when you head off to your room. Two fast elevators serve the 20 floors of which I believe all have 4 rooms per floor. This is a small hotel. Actually it is to small. I have stayed in many in Europe with fewer rooms but they provide enough space to service the hotel. We were there 5 days every day fresh linen was in carts parked near the entrance of the hotel. Yes linen outside on a cart all day and all night I guess because it was always there. More linen and cleaning carts in the emergency stairwell. I am not sure but could imagine that would be illegal. The breakfast room I believe had 3 tables maybe 4 never really used the area other than to get coffee because I just didn't want to stand in the heat to eat breakfast. The place was always elbow to elbow and they were out of coffee two days and out of cups two days. If you want to wait awhile it will show up eventually. Now we are in the room. Rooms are very small, among the smallest I have ever had. Furniture is fair and the room is and was kept clean. First night the room had no toilet paper, hair dryer, and no TV remote. Some of that was fixed on the second day but never got a hair dryer. The second night we had no towels but they were aware of that and they made the delivery of the last two towels in the hotel to our room. Most importantly the rooms were quiet, the bed very comfortable and the air conditioning was great. Like I mentioned the room was clean, mostly. Those days there was no coffee in the basement there was a 4 cup maker in the room. There was always fresh coffee available but the maid never emptied the pot or toss the grounds. The neighborhood is obviously in transition there are 4 nearly new hotels on the block between 8th and 9th Ave. There is however almost that number of vacant buildings or buildings being torn down there also. Last but not least the location is near time square but you are also near the bus terminal and next door an all male club called Hunk-amania. In general from the hotel to the corner of 8th street the street and sidewalk is covered with garbage. This is not necessarily the hotels fault but the other businesses in the area on the same street keep the street an sidewalks clean near their establishments. Last buy not least the free wifi was free when you could connect. In a year or two the neighborhood may improve, the hotel may also get their service act together but until then I won't be visiting.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location, good service, good stuff"”
Reviews.Author: Lesa2011
Reviews.Content: Very good location, good service, good stuff. Near Time Square and Grand Terminal. Comfort rooms and very Soft mattresses! wi-fi is free! Nice meal. but in this building here is The night club for the men. Only. And the big guys can kisses near the entrance of the hotel )).

Reviews.Title: “STAFF WILL STEAL YOUR STUFF”
Reviews.Author: HeyChamp
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with a tour group from Montreal - our room was on the 11th floor and so was the supply room for staff. Every time we opened the door a staff member was standing outside our door which made us feel uncomfortable so we put our passports in the safe and dead bolted the door at night. On the bus ride home, my cousin realized that my headphones (I had left them on the desk) were now wrapped around her ipod which was inside her bag and her expensive headphones were missing. Bring suitcase locks if you're planning to stay at this hotel because the staff will go through your bags and take what they want.

Reviews.Title: “great staff,great location,hot breafast waffles,sausage,real bargain”
Reviews.Author: ragdolls78
Reviews.Content: We arrived early no rooms available but staff very nice would hold luggage until 3p when rms were ready..while tagging bags staff member said they had a room clean so we had very pleasant early ck in..We later found no safe in the room so staff was very kind to move us to another room which was more to my request of higher floor and better view.Hotel is small but staff ,cleanrooms,location.subways,breakfast all make up a great value for ny.. we are going back in few days..Recommend this hotel very much

Reviews.Title: “Good Location,Small rooms”
Reviews.Author: santo71
Reviews.Content: Well, I didn't had great expactions regarding the Hotel, but it was nice surprise. The concierge was very helpfull and after a quick check inn, I've move to my room. I've asked a room on a top floor and they gave me one. The room was small, but I didin't had to share it now so it was enough. The bath room was big enough. Very clean and wityh high speed internet free. You have to ask for the password. It was only one nigh, but a good sleep night. The breakfast room is so tiny that if you bring 10 friends, it will full, so the better is to take the breakfast to the room. I did it and it was much better. I recommend for short trips.

Reviews.Title: “!!!!Good Customer Service Butttt There's Bed Bugs !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: canadianvoyager50
Reviews.Content: Very Friendly Staff and the check in process is very quick. After a red eye flight the staff was able to accommodate my early check in request . I had some break fast which was your typical basic continental breakfast , the breakfast area is located in their basement which is very small ; after waiting 10 minutes for a seat I just decided to take my food upstairs . I have been a little particular in regards to staying at specific hotels in New York due to the Bed Bug Scare in the city. When I called the hotel to ask if they have ever had a history of bed bugs , they told me no . That was obviously my mistake; like they would ever admit to having them . My first impression of the room was " wow very small"but hey I guess all rooms in New York are ..I had no Towels in my room ( so they sent them upstairs) but it took 30 minutes for me to receive it . When I went down to the lobby to check out and leave my bag for storage , I was afraid to do so . There were bags everywhere ; at the front desk ,in the lobby and there storage area (which is just another guest room)was filled to capacity . I decided to drag my bag with me because there was obviously no where to leave it . This was a huge inconvenience for me since I was carrying almost 3 bags and dragging it with me through out my meetings was not comfortable. Finally When I got home , I found marks all over my back , went to the doctor and they verified that it was not a typical rash but indeed bed bug bites .. I feel so disgusted and I do plan on speaking to someone in regards to this. Please if you stay here try your best to take your own bed bug spray and check your sheets before you lay your head on those beds or even better STAY AWAY!!!

Reviews.Title: “First time NY visit”
Reviews.Author: getbusylivin1962
Reviews.Content: Great location...I stayed with a friend, and two children, 8 & 9yrs old. The rooms were small, but neat and clean. The beds were comforable and the staff was courteous, and helpful. Since we stayed for two days, the micro/fridge combo offered would have been very useful. My only challenge to this hotel would be having some "kid friendly" channels. There was no Disney, Nick or cartoon network channels for them. I know New York never sleeps, but children, who are on a schedule like to wind down with some cartoons and kid friendly programs.

Reviews.Title: “Misleading”
Reviews.Author: sunarihost
Reviews.Content: I booked a room via Choice Hotels as I do 2-3 times a month. i was confirmed in a king bed room and given a double bed ("someone entered in wrong I guess said the clerk." The room had no chair at the desk. A helpful mainenance employee found one saying that there are not enough chairs for each room to have one. Finally the TV listings bear only a little relatiohship to the list in the room and how in NYC both NBC and Fox are not available is very strange. Not a good choice given a number of midtown options.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for time square!”
Reviews.Author: kearajim
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location to Time Square and Theater district, found great restaurants in the area, and walked to Rockerfeller Center, Toys R Us, and shopping. The hotel was very clean, rooms were pretty new. This hotel is very small, I was surprised when I got to the lobby how small it was. The rooms were tiny, four of us, two adults two small kids, were squished. We were there for only two nights, so it was ok,we didnt' spend much time in the room. I thought the breakfast was good, cereal, hot waffles, bagels, fruit, muffins, yogurt. Nothing fancy, but it was good, The breakfast room was small, and it was a little difficult to get a table. I would definetly stay there again, but maybe have to get a suite. Also, heard ny has a major bedbug infestation. I inspected this room, moved the mattresses and furniture. I didn't find any signs of bedugs. One of the main reasons I chose this hotel was because it had no reports of bedbugs on www,bedbugregistry.com. I was terrified to travel to ny and pick them up. I had a good experience at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location close to Times Square and Broadway Theatre District”
Reviews.Author: Cantiveros86
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I were looking for a hotel with a reasonable price in Times Square. The hotel was able to accommodate an early check in. From the outside, appears to look like a skinny building that rises up so many floors, and it's the same inside. Roughly 4 bedrooms on each floor that reaches ~15 floors. The room had a recently remodeled/modern feel to it. Our view was of the backyard of other buildings, but we're not considered about that in NYC. Bathroom, linens, and furniture appeared clean at first impression, but it's also a small sized room. But can comfortably fit a couple. I'd definitely refer this hotel based on it's location. It's basically in between Times Square and MSG/Penn Station. Walking distances to any of those sites aforementioned. I stayed one day/one night to sightsee close amusements, shop at Macy's, eat lunch at Bubba Gump, fine dine at the Glass House Tavern, watch Wonderland broadway show, and party out in the city. It can be done with a hotel in a great location!

Reviews.Title: “Clean room, convenient location, bathroom a disaster!”
Reviews.Author: Zimmsar
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in this hotel previously, I had fairly high expectations. Unfortunately, I was disappointed to discover that this time around our bathroom had a handicapped-accessible shower (no tub or proper drainage) that flooded the entire bathroom after just one use. I didn't request a room with this type of shower and saw no indication when booking online that our room even had this feature. I explained the problem to the front desk staff and suggested that they address the issue so that people don't have to wade through a giant puddle after showering. The woman with whom we spoke was very nice and apologetic. I would definitely recommend this hotel as long as you make sure you're not getting one of these showers! The rooms are clean and adequately large, the staff are friendly, and the hotel's location is convenient. It is a little bit noisy because of the night club next door, but we didn't find this too disturbing.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: smm5628
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect for a couple, that is looking for a place to sleep. It is not a place for families or people wanting to stay in the room for a long time. We stayed for one night and only had one problem. We were in our room getting ready to go out and our door opened. It was two girls, who the front desk person gave us our room as well. So they fixed that, but when we got back at 2am our keys didn't work. So we had to go back downstairs to get it fixed. Pros Clean Cheap Comfy beds Cons Front desk screw up Small rooms

Reviews.Title: “Great location - Small rooms, but great staff and good value”
Reviews.Author: mac6641
Reviews.Content: Stayed here just for one night when attending a Broadway show. The location was great, 1/2 block off Times Square and it was very clean and comfortable. The room was small, but with newish furniture and flat screen TV. Nice sized bathroom and closet. The breakfast was not fancy (no hot waffles or eggs, etc.) but it was totally fine with bagels, toast, cereal and fresh fruit. The staff at the front desk were very friendly. Very good value for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, good value”
Reviews.Author: jimmy0999
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 4 - 2 adults and 2 children ages 11 and 13. I looked for a hotel close to Times Square area that was afforable, under 150, included breakfast (my needs) and queen sized beds (my husband's request). I found just this in the hotel. One room with 2 queen sized beds, breakfast and close walking distance to Times Square. Very narrow building with 4 rooms per floor. Room was fine, clean, front desk was professional. The breakfast which was the standard Comfort Inn buffet breakfast met our needs - even 4 bagels and juice in Times Square would be costly. The kids filled up on good stuff, yogurt, fruit. Location was in the garment district which was kind of cool after walking Project Runway. We did not, though, pass the store Mood. The one thing that we did spend more $ on than we hoped was parking. Good news is that iit is across the street from the hotel, can get into the car as needed, staff was helpful. Bad news is that it cost us $50 for the one day for our minivan. We still paid under $200 for the room and parking and even had breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: ceejay17
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our 5 night stay at this hotel. We were a group of 4 women/girls so we had a room with 2 double beds. The room was perfect for our needs and was cleaned everday. the staff were friendly and helpful and the breakfast was an excellent start to the day, even if the dining area is on the small side. One of the greatest assets to this hotel is its location it is close to Times Square Macys and the bus terminal. I would definatly recommend this hotel for anyone who wants to be in the centre of things and is on a budget. We had an absolutly fab time and the hotel added to it.

Reviews.Title: “Five-star for value! Great accommodations for a great price.”
Reviews.Author: dbljo7
Reviews.Content: Everything that I saw is remodeled and rennovated; lobby, elevator, room, and bathroom. The rooms and bathrooms were clean. The sheets and towels were changed and made everyday. Everything seems compact but it even had an exercisse room with ellipticals and treadmills. There was also an office room with free computer, internet, and printing access! There was 24-hour coffee service in the lounge/breakfast room. For the price of the hotel, I could not have asked for more. I was actually VERY pleased for the price and the value that Comfort Inn gave, including free breakfast. For the size of the building, I think Comfort Inn Times Square planned the space and building as best they could. Everything seems a little compact; hallways, elevators, gym room, computer room, and rooms (probably half the size what you would expect from the Hilton or Hyatt), but my husband and I do not take up too much space all in all. :) But my emphasize here is the best value all around on a limited budget. The Comfort Inn building is an older but very nice building whose architecture conforms to that of the rest of New York City architecture (the intricate carvings on the facade). I'm sure the building has a rich history as most of the buildings in Manhattan. The best part is, it's half a block from the epic Times Square! The next best part is, it's near all the public transportation, both the busses and subways, all heading in both directions, Queens, Bronx, and Brooklyn. Half a block towards the east, subways B, D, F, M; One block towards the west (in Times Square), subways N, Q, R are all available, within 1-2 blocks walking distance. My husband and I bought a 7-day Metro card that took us from Times Square to Central Park, downtown Manhattan, Queens, Coney Island, and everything in between. You can also take the subway to Bronx and Brooklyn but didn't have a chance. If you're looking to go on a trip to NY with a tight budget, I would recommend Comfort Inn Times Square. Do not hesitate to book your accommodations here! I hope you have the same pleasant surprise as me and my husband did especially for the price.

Reviews.Title: “good enough place on first visit to america”
Reviews.Author: liam3333
Reviews.Content: we are young couple that just visited america and new york for first time...we got bus to port attority which was 25 dollars each for return..which was great price ..so we got bus to port and we got off the thats when we relized we didnt have a clue where we had to go for hotel.we turned right and started walking .we ask several people did they know were the hotel was based or what direction .no one new then we diced we will get a taxi so wee seen a yellow cab parked and we ask him and he laughed and told us we were standing around the corner from it..so was great as we only walking for 5 mins at the most and we got to hotel and we didnt have a credit card as we are a young couple so we had to pay 100 dollars deposit straigh away ..they wouldnt accecpt debit cards any thing only credit card .which when we were waiting they accepted a bank card off the people in front of us (who we knew )...well the font off hotel scared me a little and so did the lobby .i tough ooh no what did we let are selfs in for .but once we got to room we were suprzed .they were really nice any bigger than we were expecting after reading reveiws on this site ...and are t.v on the wall .it was a real nice room and the showers are great and and scalding hot all the time if u wanted it...i did cause it was that cold out side lol..maids came everuy day and cleaned are rooms and we had money and phones and ipods and all lying around and they were moved to side of bed and not a single thing stole...which was assureing.if we went bk to new york i would stay hear again as by the end of the week we knew excally where every thing was and accaully how closer we were to any thing we wanted to do...we stayed from 13 december to 17th which was 600 dollars.i think

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: parkoSydney
Reviews.Content: Comfort Inn was a really nice hotel - rooms - not big but NY rooms are not, but this room was quite large, enough for 2 ladies & 4 suitcases in total. Very pleasant staff, especially the girl on reception who helped us with email probs. Nice breakfast. Only real downside is I prefer to be on 7th ave but it is only a block & a clean, nice, safe place is worth a blocks walk. Had street facing room & no noise eventhough club next door.

Reviews.Title: “Ridiculous policy - Would never choose again!!!”
Reviews.Author: LondonDudeLondon
Reviews.Content: Firstly, let me state from the top, that I have yet arrive. Therefore marks for Cleanliness, Location, Rooms, and Sleep Quality have been rated as Average. The reason why I am writing this negative review is due to their reservation policy, of which I have encountered today (one month prior to date of stay). I was originally planning to stay in NYC for 3 nights, therefore I made a reservation at the 'Comfort Inn Times Square'. Upon being informed I needed to stay one additional night, I simply googled 'Comfort Inn Times Square', and made the reservation. Little did I realise (as someone is not familiar with the area), that I had actually reserved a room with 'Comfort Inn Times Square South'. Aware of my blunder, I had phoned CI - South. The worker had said, "Not a problem to cancel and get your refund, just call in the morning, 'cause you need my manager." So, as instructed, I had phone the next day. When speaking with the manager, I was told that no refund could be made, nor could I have my reservation transferred to 'Comfort Inn Times Square'. Basically, the best management could do was to re-arrange the date of my stay within the next 2 months. By the way, this is only the 2nd time I'm coming to NYC in 36 years... I'm sure I won't visit within the next 2 months. It's not like I don't want to give my money to Comfort Inn, I just don't want to have to shift hotels for just one night!!! Again, the blunder, confusing: "Comfort Inn Times Square" "Comfort Inn Times Square - South" I'm admitting fault for mixing them up, but as someone who isn't familiar with NYC hotels, is it that difficult to switch from one Comfort Inn to another? Give me a break. Would never book a Comfort Inn ever again, incredibly unhelpful, unsupportive... you'll get my stay at NYC, just never again, anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good price”
Reviews.Author: norman81
Reviews.Content: Well located, good value for the price. I had no problems, room was clean and comfortable. I will absolutely stay in this hotel next time I am in N.Y.C.

Reviews.Title: “not what it says on the tin”
Reviews.Author: louy2010
Reviews.Content: Arrived in Manhattan by taxi. Taxi driver couldn't find the hotel, so he dropped us off where he thought it was. This was because the hotel when we eventually found it was hidden by scaffolding. ( And, is advertised as Times Square, which it isn't, it's actually on west 39th Street in the garment area.) The entrance was therefore shabby, dusty and a total eye sore. Booked in, the staff were lovely and very friendly. I specifically requested a high floor as I had been to New York before and knew this could be an advantage. We entered our hotel room which was a twin. The furniture was shabby, scratched and very tired and outdated to say I was disappointed would be an understatement. However, the room and bathroom were clean. The hotel windows could open but the noise was incredible, you expect it in New York but where the hotel was situated seemed worse and the windows could have benefited from more noise proof. The hotel provided a free breakfast which was very nice. It was a basic buffet choice of cakes, pastries, waffles, cereal juices and hot drinks. This was a godsend and I couldn't find fault. I personally wouldn't use this hotel again for the price I paid. It's cheap and cheerful but only if you get it at a cheap price is it worth it. If you don't mind basic and tired and are just looking for a bed to rest your head then it's okay. I'm sure if they spruce up the inside as they are attempting to spruce up the outside then I might change my opinion but it would have been nice to know about the building works, and when a hotel says Times Square then it should mean Times Sqaure!!

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently situated to Times Square”
Reviews.Author: onceayeartraveller
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at this hotel for 6 nights. On arrival there were problems with a loose electrical plug in the room, the water not draining out of the bath and the clock/radio not working. We reported this to the manager and a handyman was sent almost immediately to repair the situation. The clock/radio was never fixed but we managed without it. This hotel is a no-frills, basic hotel, conveniently situated to Times Square, only 3 blocks away in the Fashion District (formerly called the Garment District). They offer an excellent complimentary continental breakfast which is a huge plus, the room was clean and comfortable, although small, (but one can't expect a big room in NY) with a king size bed and a large screen TV. The bathroom was a good size with decent shower and bath. This hotel is fairly new, being only 3 years old. Although the front desk staff were not unfriendly, they do not fall over their guests as I have experienced at other hotels. On one occasion when our room was not done by 4 p.m. we complained and the rest of the week the room was done earlier in the day. These are all minor things and it does pay to complain and all our complaints were speedily attended to. On the whole I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice new beds.. Short walk to Times Square.. Great Value”
Reviews.Author: dovestravel
Reviews.Content: Rooms are small but the big tall window was nice.. Big TV, nice clean bathroom. Best value for what you get and location in my opinion. Beds were very comfortable, nice white duvet, and that is important to me. They had a conceirge there all day, I didnt expect this but was a nice touch. Very freindly front desk and willing to help and supply maps. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent price, decent stay, who could say no to that?”
Reviews.Author: zeldash
Reviews.Content: After researching our tirp for months before coming here, and reading all the reviews of this hotel on this website, I must admit I didn't have my hopes up too high, but my husband and I were okay with a small room, seeing as how were weren't planning on spending much time in there anyways. I had an excellent stay here. When we arrived, we were checked in quickly and painlessly. Our room on the 8th floor was clean. It was not as small as I was expecting, but still pretty small. I had to move stuff off of the desk to put my suitcase on it, and my husband had to store his underneath. There is not much room beside the bed, maybe enough for just one person to walk. The bathroom was nice. It seemed recently renovated. The air conditioning worked, which was good because they were having a heat wave when we were there. Our room overlooked the road, but there wasn't that much street noise that came in. I'll admit that the breakfast room is quite small. We were there one day at 7 am and that was really the only time we could find a seat down there. We ended up taking the tray from our room to load food on and take breakfast back upstairs. It is in the perfect location if you are up for a little walking. Right around the corner is an access point to a big subway station, with a connection underground to the TImes Square station. We were only 3 blocks away from Times Squre (far enough to not hear the sounds, but close enough for a quick walk over). Overall, excellent hotel, I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: jonnyboy67
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 7 days in mid august,the room was clean was 15 floors up and quiet although with the air conditioning on it would be impossible to hear anything outside but the aircon was needed-the one night we didn't use you do hear the taxis sounding their horns about every 10 seconds-for no reason! The reception staff were friendly,not so much the 2 canteen women. The canteen is as already said very small,we got there between 7 & 9am but always got a table with a short wait. The location is good but on the periphery of seediness with xxx stores close by but at the price you pay we were willing to put up with that so don't let that put you off- there are plenty other chain hotels nearby eg holiday inn express. We felt very safe.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value hotel”
Reviews.Author: pmerick63
Reviews.Content: Everything was great with this hotel - location, beds, pillows, room service, internet access, elevator, staff, breakfast, etc. We stayed 6 nights and only hit a crowd at breakfast one day. The elevator was almost always immediatly available. The rooms were small as expected, but the beds were very comfortable and the rooms were well kept. The location was very good, with only a short walk to the chaos of Times Square. I would definitly recommend this hotel to anyone heading to New York.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money, all things considered”
Reviews.Author: appleton1909
Reviews.Content: At the time of booking, this location appeared to offer the best value for money - however obviously value for money is subjective and seasonal. +ves: 1 block from subway station and Port Authority bus terminal 5-10 minute walk to Times Square and theatres 5-10 minute walk to Penn Station Continental Breakfast included Recently constructed and furnished Self-service laundry on 9th Av and lots of fast food on 8th Av if you're on a budget Free wireless internet access -ves: During peak, breakfast room is at capacity so you have to eat elsewhere Charged me $10 for no apparent reason (was later reversed by Mastercard) Newspaper not delivered once out of 5 nights, despite being reminded once Shower curtains should not be made of permeable material Comment on other reviews: Noise from surrounding properties weren't a problem for me. Nightclub was no big deal either, although it may help being several floors up.

Reviews.Title: “New York, New York!”
Reviews.Author: muuummmmm
Reviews.Content: Hotel didn't look to good from the outside but inside it was nice. The rooms were quite small but they were done out nicely, were clean and had a large LCD TV. One thing for ladies to note though, there was no hairdryer but there was an iron and ironing board! Rooms were cleaned everyday and the staff were plesant. There was a free breakfast offered but we never got up in time for it so I cannot tell you what it was like. Really good location, it is 2 blocks away from Times Square and just around the corner from Port Authority where you can get the metro everywhere (inc direct to JFK skytrain which is handy). Plus there is a little cafe shop near which seemed to be open all the time and was perfect for getting a little late night snack of Pizza or Gelato on the way back to the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Comfort Inn Times Square - Stay at the most happening place”
Reviews.Author: svinod3
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Comfort Inn at Times Square that is the most happening place in NewYork. The stay was very comfortable and the view from the rooms was awesome. As it was peak winter, we could see snow all around. Although, it could be troublesome as it is very difficult to navigate through the streets, it is a pleasant sight for the eyes. You can see tonnes of salt being poured on the ice. It is white everywhere. The hotel location is very convenient if you have to go around NewYork. The city is very well connected by trains. The city is very colourful with lots of shopping malls, eat-outs, skyscrapers. The hotel rooms are very clean and cosy. You will really enjoy the stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: thora_mike
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to New York, and if I was coming back any time I would book there again. The staff were friendly and helpful, yes my room was small, but all I needed was a place to sleep, which I did very well. Location is great for vacationers, 1/2 block from Times Square, short walks to Ed Sullivan Theatre (David Letterman), Broadway, Rockefeller Centre, St Patrick's Cathedral. Easy access to Central Park, Empire State Bldg, 5th Ave, many more places.

Reviews.Title: “a weekend getaway....with a Smile :)”
Reviews.Author: Philly_Born81
Reviews.Content: I had stayed with my 2 friends to catch the Sights and Sounds of the City.... It was a Birthday weekend for one of My best friends. We searched alot of places and we finally decided to stay here. I have to say the stay was Great! From the moment we walked in early in the morning the staff was on there game. it was quite busy but they were keeping it together... we tried to get in early but couldnt since no room was available. They offered to hold are bags until a room would be ready later on. While we had to decide what to do until then the desk clerk suggested the Concierge for us. They gave us a few options to kill some time...afterards I asked the Front Desk where we could get a bite to eat and The lady at the desk said "well we are still serving complementary Breakfast downstairs you are more than welcome to have some"... that is a great way to start the day... a few bagels...some coffee...and Fresh Waffuls and Juice. :) anyways we did the whole sight seeing thing until we came back around 2pm. A room was ready by then and we got are bags...went to the room and freshened up. Now a word on the room itself we had a room with 2 Double Beds... I have stayed in bigger rooms before yes but i didnt feel claustophobic at all. We had a flat pannel TV... Coffee maker and Iron in the room. Internet WIFI was available also NO CHARGE :) clean also... thats all I will say about the room I mean c'mon who goes into the NYC and stay in there hotel room? honestly are weekend was great the staff was very in the know of the area....Times Square is always busy with people (which by the way is only 3 blocks from the hotel cant beat that) whether it was 3pm or 3am are highlights for are trips were Statue of liberty -the Yankee game -Times Square -and of cource Bar Hopping (there are a few blackout moments there) lol thank goodness there is always a cab insight and the staff they always greeted us coming and going....and i have seen some pretty Fake people who only go through the motions...and these arent them they genuinely like being there at it shows...at the end of our stay they let us print are boarding passes...and also held are bags till later we finished are day in a bus tour on a nice sunny day... a good end to all are frenzy night activities the day before.. :) I would definitley come back

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT stay here!!”
Reviews.Author: Gem3388
Reviews.Content: Room was tiny and with only 4 rooms to each floor.. very noisy from other guests using elevators and banging doors. On the first night, I noticed a bug crawling on the bed, after having the window open for a small time, I thought it may have just been something that had crawled in. Two days later I came out in this terrible rash on my shoulders, which then turned into painful and itchy welts extending to my arms, hand, legs and face (including eyelids!!!) the following day. The same day, my friend came out in the same thing. We could not work out what it was at first so on returning home from the trip, I went to the doctor and did some of my own research.... the welts are the result of being bitten by Bed BUGS!! Disgusting!! All I can say is... Do not stay here!

Reviews.Title: “NOT FOR TOURISTS MORE FOR BUSINESS TRIPS”
Reviews.Author: JOYCOT
Reviews.Content: This hotel is good if you only want somewhere to put your head at night. It was a good location for Midtown Manhattan. The bed in the room was wonderful and the staff were friendly. However, the rooms are for overnight business trips not tourists. The bed was large but you had no room to get around it and nowhere to put your luggage or clothes - the single wardrobe was too small and there was no other storage. There is a lot of restoration going on in New York so the hotel had scaffolding outside - we weren't aware of this prior to the trip. Our street was constantly covered with trash. It was not a good impression. The 'restaurant' could not accommodate the number of people for breakfast unless you went down at 6.30am. Having said this it did not stop us enjoying our trip but I would not choose this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK Comfort Inn”
Reviews.Author: artnuvo
Reviews.Content: The hotel is 50 feet in W. 39 from 8th Ave. The very tiny lobby has a nondescript check in counter, a couch, 2 chairs, and a concierge desk. The staff is friendly and helpful. But our King bedded room on the 12th floor needed updating and some cleaning. The black painted plywood furniture was scarred and the headboard and the bedspread needed to be cleaned. The room was quite small, with barely inches to slide pass the desk chair to the window side. Storage space is a small upright cabinet to hang clothes--there are no drawers. The bed was comfortable and the room was quiet. However, the tight grouping of four rooms to a floor with elevator in the middle distributes the noise from guests entering their rooms particularly at early hours. The hotel is convenient to Times Square, just 2 blocks distant and 9th Ave Restaurant Row-try Basilica for its prix fix 3-course $29 excellent dinner with a bottle of wine and/or Hell's Kitchen diagonal to it on W 467 for excellent upscale Mexican with flair. This was a non-frills room at a $200+ rate that, under the circumstances, would have us stay another time at the Holiday Inn Express further down the block with slightly larger room and better equipped(see prior review earlier this year) or the nicer Courtyard on W. 40 & Broad

Reviews.Title: “Think twice before booking this hotel”
Reviews.Author: sandpiperpat
Reviews.Content: This hotel is adjacent to a hip-hop club. To approach this property after 10 PM, thur through sat, you have to run a gauntlet. The bouncers next door are frisking the attendees and limos are blocking the street. The hotel management calls their neighbor a "disco". Additionally they put an "out of order" sign on their locked restroom in their basement and refuse to allow even guests to use it at night. The shower curtain in our room (1608) was too short resulting in our bathroom appearing to be the East River. I filled out these complaints in the survey they sent me after our stay and have heard nothing back. Basically they don't care....... The elevators are fast though.

Reviews.Title: “Manhattan Central”
Reviews.Author: CliffWalker
Reviews.Content: I would agree with most of the good comments about this property. It is good value for money right in midtown Manhattan. With just a little more attention to easily modified details, this hotel could be so much better. The rooms we saw vary quite a bit in terms of layout and furnishings - each with its pluses and minuses - each just missing the mark. Hanging space in all the rooms was inadequate as was shelf space in the bathrooms. Housekeeping, too, was inconsistent. We had booked three rooms for the three of us. On our first night we were given the two basement rooms and one (of the two available) on the ground floor. The basement rooms had been recently flooded and the carpets were wringing wet and smelling. Reception staff seemed unaware of their condition until we told them. We were offered three rooms at a location in Long Island City for the night with the promise of acceptable rooms at West 39th Street the next day. We took the offer and were transported to Long Island and back free of charge. Next day we got the new rooms and were given credit on the two basement rooms for the night lost. Of course, we lost the holiday time involved in negotiation and travel. You might think our experience would have put us off using this hotel again; nothing could be further from the truth. From the second night on we had a great stay, mostly because of the first class reception and concierge staff who were friendly, helpful and anxious to do what they could to ensure we had a good time in Manhattan. Particular mention must be made of Hugo, receptionist, who was outstanding, and Vitek (?) the Polish concierge.

Reviews.Title: “Well Located and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: MStraveler8
Reviews.Content: It is in a good location. Close to many things but not on top of the noise areas. Staff was friendly. Rooms were not real big but ok for our needs.

Reviews.Title: “Walking distance to Times Square + clean + breakfast = very good value for money”
Reviews.Author: montreality
Reviews.Content: This is a good choice If you want a comfortable and clean place just to sleep, while exploring all that NYC has to offer during the day. It was my first visit to NYC, and my partner's first in several years, so the location of the hotel was very convenient. Maybe there are nicer hotels for the same rate (which really isn't expensive for downtown Manhattan!) but it suited our purposes just fine. The included breakfast wasn't bad. There was variety and it was enough to start the day right. Try to be in the dining area before 8 am if you want a table to sit at, worst case scenario you can just take your plate back to your room- no big deal. It's true that there are rooms on the ground floor. We found this a bit strange. We arrived late on our first night and had a choice between ground floor or basement. We decided on a basement room, and there were no disturbances at all. The receptionist did say we could switch the next morning at around 10 or 11 am, but we ended up staying in the same one because it was fine. The room was a bit on the small side but not small enough that it felt like a closet (why would you care about room size if you are in an exciting city like New York??) All in all, we were satisfied with this hotel and I would recommend it for those on a tight budget. You save money (cheaper rate than surrounding hotels, breakfast included, prime location..) yet the place is still clean and not sketchy.

Reviews.Title: “A much recommended hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Rhys3287
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Comfort Inn just before Christmas 2009 and we were both more than happy with our stay at the hotel. The location is fantastic, just down from Penn St. railway and subway station and minutes from Times Square. The hotel is a bit hidden away but once you've got your bearings it is very easy to find and very good as a base from which to explore NY. Throughout our stay, every member of the reception staff we saw were very welcoming, friendly and helpful and always had the time to greet us on our way through. The concierge staff were also very helpful and always had ideas and recommendations on where to eat and how to get around. The room was left spotlessly clean and tidy every day and both it and the bathroom were of a good size. The beds were very comfortable and our room looked as if it had only recently been refitted so was a very nice place to be in. The breakfast provided at the hotel was always very well stocked with a massive range of foods to suit most people and the member of staff on duty each morning was very welcoming. The only thing with the breakfast room was that it did get a little full if you are going to eat after around 8.30am as the seating is a little lacking. In all, the Comfort Inn Times Sq, is a great value for money, brilliant little hotel and I would very much recommend it to anyone looking to visit New York. You won't be dissapointed!

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: Amy_F_00
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 4 nights over Labor Day weekend 2009 using my Choice Hotel points. It was a very good location, just a few blocks away from Times Square. The hotel was very neat and clean. The staff was very friendly every time I encountered them. Check in and check out was quick and easy. There is a concierge available if you have any questions about anything or need transportation to the airport. The free breakfast that was provided was pretty good. The only cons I would say is that the rooms are quite small and cramped, especially if you are there with more than 1 person. The breakfast area is also quite small. They did not have a business center/computer available for guests….I had to go down the street and pay for a computer at the internet café. I do believe that they may have internet hook ups in the rooms themselves, but I do not have a personal laptop, and if I did I wouldn't have brought it on vaction to NYC with me. They also did not have any sort of gym equipment there. But I’d say that I had an overall good experience at this hotel. I would stay in this hotel again somewhere down the road.

Reviews.Title: “all essentials,breakfast,gym,free computer&printer”
Reviews.Author: ja_healy02
