Reviews.Content: I stayed here last week with my partner&mother-in-law, i've been to NYC before &have stayed in the Rittz&Le Meridian hotel both 5 star...all I can say is if you are travelling to new york for leisure&you want to spend your money on shops/sights/night life then why pay a fortune for a room you barely spend any time in?!! This hotel is spotless, reception area is a bit dated but rooms are compact/clean/tv/air conditioning. There is a little gym which has a treadmill, bike,stepper&vibration plate, computer room with free internet access& printer& complimentary breakfast. You are right beside Times Square, lovely cuban restaurant just to the right iof the hotel and only a few minutes walk from everything. Basically if you are used to your bit of luxury but are going to NYC like I did to shop not spend your time in the room well then this is your hotel... very popular with Germans& Russians and check in/out quick and effecient.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels I've stayed in in NYC for the money!”
Reviews.Author: shelltattoo
Reviews.Content: I've been going to NYC for over 20 years every Thanksgiving and stayed in a lot of hotels...this is by far the best hotel I've stayed in. The value for the money was outstanding. To start with, the front desk staff was so helpful - especially one of the front desk staff named Willie - he always had a smile and hello for us coming or going. The breakfast was excellent and a great way to start the day - muffins, pastries, cereals, fruit, hard boiled eggs, fresh made waffles, juices, coffee, and more. Breakfast room was a little small, but you could take food back to rooms. The rooms had the most modern and up-to-date decor I have seen in NYC, even the bathrooms were modern. Location was great - very close to Times Square. I'm telling you - you will not find better hotel for the money in NYC. Yes - rooms are small, but in NYC all hotel rooms are small. I've already booked this hotel for next Thanksgiving.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location and friendly helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: In_my_view
Reviews.Content: My wife, two daughters and I have never been to New York before and I was a bit worried about the location of the hotel in relation to the city centre and would we be miles from the activities. The answer to this, staying at this hotel is a definate no, you are really close to Times Square. Our break was 5 nights B&B. We got the bus from Newark Airport (cost $25 return per person. Would cost $15 one way) and got off at the Port Authority Bus Depot. It literally is a 5 minute easy walk to the hotel and a waste of money if you were to use a taxi. The hotel had construction work on going outside but this did not impact on our stay. We got a twin bed room on the 10th floor and it was small but functional, given the limited time we were in the room. The bathroom was a good size and had shower, bath and washbasin. There was a hairdryer there as well. (Remember to take an adapter for phone chargers, hair straightners etc). There was not a lot of wardrobe space so we tended to leave stuff in the cases. There was an iron and board although we never used it. Tea coffee making was also provided. Breakfast was on level 1 and consisted of a wide selection of pastries, freshly made muffins, cereals, fresh fruit and tea coffee and fruit juices. The eating area was small but functional and you could take food back to your room. We ate breakfast two mornings but ended up going for breakfast at a place called Tick Tock which is near Madison Square Gardens. There are so many things to do and places to eat that you will not be stuck for choice. At the end of our stay we kept the room for $50 as it needed to be vacated by 11.00am and our flight was not until 7.50pm. The hotel staff explained we had two choices. 1- We vacate the room by 11.00am and they would look after our luggage. 2- We pay $50 dollars and keep the room until 7pm. We decided the latter and we were glad we did as my wife and daughter did not feel like going out and about the last day. If I was returning to New York I would use this hotel again. That said I would also check Trip Advisor to see if there was better available. If you are booked here then you have nothing to worry about and if you are still to book then I would recommend this place to you but would also suggest you do your own homework as there could be better "little gems" out there.

Reviews.Title: “great find”
Reviews.Author: DeannaPa
Reviews.Content: Staff was very pleasant and helpful. Excellent central location on 46th St. Room was spotless, plenty of towels. Instant internet connection. Parking was convenient and discounted. Great value for a great price. Very impressed and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Clean rooms and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: rumblintums
Reviews.Content: very very close to times square, small but clean and new rooms, continental breakfast included which was nice enough - bagels, english muffins, freshly made waffles, ceareal tea coffee hot choc, breakfast room was small but clean all in all a nice hotel for a busy city break if you don't want to spend too much money on your hotel

Reviews.Title: “Convenient for travel and major attractions”
Reviews.Author: g0akc
Reviews.Content: The hotel isn't in Times Square, but it's not far from it (a couple of blocks). Some rooms overlook the current Times newspaper offices and the main bus terminal (which makes it convenient for buses, a taxi dispatch and several subway lines - stations for various lines are interconnected by underground walkways there). The neighbourhood isn't great looking though there are some well run deli's and coffee shops nearby. I read somewhere (Choice hotels site?) that the hotel has a restaurant - they must have mixed that up as it doesn't, thought there are places to eat nearby. We've been to New York before and know hotels are pretty expensive there, like many other big cities where real estate is at a premium. We got a good rate (for the date) via Quick Book and stayed a whole week at this property. We paid a bit more per night than on previous trips, but the room was a whole lot better, and there were more facilities including breakfast. The first room we were allocated wasn't the type we booked, but I got the duty manager to change it as we wanted a king size and just one bed. The 4th floor room was clean, modern and well appointed with a good TV, safe large enough for a laptop plus cameras, passports etc. The rooms are however small and there's isn't a lot of space for luggage - you have to be disciplined with your stuff. The bathroom was fine - clean and everything worked well including the shower (to operate the shower you have to pull down on a small ring on the end of the bath tub faucet/tap spout which can be confusing). I used the free wifi successfully several times with both a laptop and a wifi phone. Connection speed was OK. You have to get the access code from reception. We had no trouble sleeping. The bed was very comfortable, the aircon worked if you wanted it, you could open the window for fresh air (though that made it a little noisy with the sounds of the city). I asked about a refrigerator/microwave but apparently they only had 3 rooms with those facilities, which were all in use. In the end we didn't need them, and chilled a bottle of wine using the ice bucket. We had a few minor niggles during our stay, but most of these were dealt with by the front desk staff - the maid took the complimentary newspaper away before we had a chance to read it, the phone wouldn't allow me to make a local call and so on. Be aware that there may be a small daily charge if you use the safe. The breakfast was good, with a selection of cakes and pastries, cereal, juice and waffles. The breakfast room, in the basement, is small but adequate. Some problems come from how guests behave and use it, with some folks choosing to sit long after they have finished eating, seemingly oblivious to other guests waiting. It pays to get in there early if possible, and you can always grab something and take it back to your room. Tea/coffee were available there 24/7 along with complimentary snack bars. There were also vending machines and a ice maker. There was also a coffee machine in the room and the maid left enough for a couple of cups each day. Bottled water was also provided in the room some days. All the staff at the hotel were great, particularly the guy running the breakfast room. The front entrance and lobby weren't great to look at, particularly as there was construction work going on when we were there, and you sometimes get bags of trash piled up, but it's functional. There's a concierge desk available for booking tours, tickets and transportation, though we didn't use it. There's a small waiting area in the lobby and the staff will hold luggage for you. They kindly let us use the restroom downstairs to change and sort out our luggage before our transatlantic flight home.

Reviews.Title: “Filthy, Noisy Hotel. Appropriate customer service.”
Reviews.Author: ObservantEscapades
Reviews.Content: My friend & I booked this hotel last minute with nowhere else to stay in New York. We arrived on a Saturday night, greeted by an enormous pile of black rubbish bags and 'Escuelitas', the nightclub next door, in full swing. There were lots of the club kids hanging around by the hotel entrance. The entrance & reception area of the hotel are dirty & small. Our room was located in the basement, where you could hear the music from the nightclub, thumping through the walls. It also stank of damp, & was tiny. There was the bed, & room for me to walk in front of it & down one side. The walls were marked & dirty, with torn portions of wallpaper. The bed cover had large stains on it including (I hope) what looked like some sort of blue candle wax. How anyone is supposed to sleep in this room is beyond me. The tv had no remote, there were no bin liners in the bins and there were no opening windows, but there was a balcony door, which, when I asked, I was given a key to. However, the air con system chucks out warm air here, into a dirty smelly courtyard. The smell was bad. We shut the door again and braved the damp smell inside. The bathroom, was actually clean, and of a surprisingly high standard when compared with the room itself. We asked to be moved, but the hotel was full. The staff said they would relocate us the next day. We attempted to use the kitchen facilities to make some food & discovered tomorrows breakfast, sitting (bagged) on the floor in a dirty closet. The plates were made of polysterene & mine actually melted from a piece of toast sitting on it. The kitchen & cleaning cupboards were both on our floor, so after a night of trying to sleep, we were disturbed all morning by people coming to use facilities, and the cleaning cupboards which are also on that floor. The staff knocked twice within an hour, wanting to relocate us. Clearly all we wanted to do was sleep, but this was never going to happen. We were VERY tired. We had had a long flight the night before. This was our first New York experience. We also had no idea of real day light, or the weather from this low level room, making it even harder to get motivated. We relocated to a room on much higher level (16?). The view, of all the buildings, and dirty, treeless streets was actually quite depressing, but any lower floors on the same side would have had a view of a car park below. The window at least opened a crack, but again, the bed sheets were dirty & smelt disgusting, I mean AWFUL-no way was I sleeping in them tonight. They brought us our own refrigerator & microwave so we could avoid the kitchen level, but by then I had discovered the bathroom door did not shut, the shower head was broken, still no bin liners in the bins & I had just had enough of this hotel now. We spent the day finding another hotel, and relocating. This meant coming back for our things & asking to be transferred (to another Comfort Inn). They said they would charge us for both nights & that a transfer was not possible due to the hotels bring under different management. (If we had booked through an agent it was apparently possible). We were told we would have to come back the following day to discuss this with management, & ask for our money back. The manager was currently unavailable. Our first day in New York was ruined by lack of sleep, money spent on around town & worrying about finding another available hotel. We DID get all our money back for the nights charged. But it took a lot of time, effort & wasting the precious time we had in the city, & were not compensated for that. On making the right choice on where to stay in New York again, I know that this is not the answer.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: benfan73
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Comfort Inn for 3 nights. It's less than a block away from a metro station, and very close to Times Square. We were also able to walk just a few blocks to see Wicked. The hotel had just opened last month, so the rooms were very clean, if not a little small. The windows were very thin, so you can hear ALL the street noise all night long. There is a bar on the same block, so it got really loud sometimes. We stayed here for only $120 per night. The staff was very helpful, and there's a very nice continental breakfast served each morning.

Reviews.Title: “THE HELL HOLE OF NEW YORK.”
Reviews.Author: bowlerbazza
Reviews.Content: I want to start by saying this is my first ever review but after staying at this hotel i feel its only right to tell people to stay away. It all started when you first pull up to the hotel it looking like a building site with rubbish bags all over the the place and to say they smell it was like being at a rubbish tip, Also i would like to add that before you get in the hotel you always have to walk pass the hotel staff puffing away on their cigrettes 2 inches from the door. After this you walk through to the reception area which is more dirty than any i have ever known i really wanted to wash my hands after touching any thing in that room. To be honest the staff behind the desk were ok cant complain about that they gave me the key and off i went after tripping over 10 bags as the room is so small. So up the lift i went to the 14th floor hallway was clean so that was a good point. Into the room well when i say room more like a cupboard i thought it was going to be small but a place for the suitcase would of been nice then to top it all off looked out of the window into the building opposite you could see what was on there computers so you need to leave the blind down all day which does not help when you feel your in a prison cell any way. The next morning after a good night sleep as the bed is nice at last the hotel has got something right we went down to the breakfast room, we took one look at this and laughed and went out for breakfast i did not fancy eating 1 inch away from the person next to you seriously it was that small and im not lying. The location of the hotel is very good as its right on times square but the avenue its on is dirty smelly and just a hell hole there is no way that my wife would of gone out on that road at night on her own. Then to top all this off the last morning we got up and checked out which the person on the desk just took the key and did not say a word which i thought was rude and as the hotel had booked the taxi for us i just politely asked is that my taxi outside and his reply was DONT KNOW JUST GO AND ASK this was so rude so i just walked out. Right i must finish with this hotel is cheap BUT DONT STAY HERE AND IF YOU HAVE BOOKED I FEEL VERY SORRY FOR YOU.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: JandBNS
Reviews.Content: Great location at Time Square. Rooms were clean, bed was comfortable, breakfast adequate start to the day.

Reviews.Title: “Small, but certainly suitable”
Reviews.Author: SVDH
Reviews.Content: My 2 daughters and I (from The Netherlands) enjoyed our 4-night stay at the Comfort Inn Times Square. The location was perfect, near to Times Square, Broadway, the open-top tour buses, a Starbucks and the subway. We came in on the Airtrain and Subway from JFK which was easy and the hotel is next to the Port Authority. Don't be put off by the exterior (building work and rubbish on the street), inside all is fine (remember this is a 2-3* hotel). The whole hotel is a bit on the small side from the lobby to the rooms, but these are modern and clean smelling and the bathroom in our room was very clean with a daily change of towels. We did have a problem understanding how to work the shower though! We had read about the small breakfast room, but it was adequate and the bagels, toast, cereals and muffins were good and made an easy start to the day. As for the service, we are Europeans so our expectations are generally lower. (Americans expect more, we have got used to putting up with less!). For us there was nothing at all to complain about at all. The desk staff were polite, I was immediately informed about the free wireless internet for my iphone which was perfect (most business hotels I have stayed in recently charged EUR 12 a day) and the hotel stored our luggage (lots of it) for free on the last day. For our mother and daughter trip to New York this hotel was certainly suitable and I would recommend it to anyone who is planning to spend most of their time in New York seeing the signts and not staying in their room.

Reviews.Title: “Great location..but sometimes that's just not enough”
Reviews.Author: shellygalway
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel from reviewing others good comments so I will start my review with the good!Check-in staff were very friendly and professional and a credit to the hotel. Breakfast was nice..although the breakfast area is small it serves it's purpose. As you may have read from previous reviews..the staff in the restaurant are prompt in removing the breakfast away on the stroke on 09.30 and although I arrived on time I observed a guest having to argue with a member of staff in order to get a bagel at 0930(due to their prompt service of removing everything) so therefore a piece of advise..tell people the buffet closes at 09.15 so they have at least 15 mins to grab afew things or stay with the orinigal time of 09.30 and give people 15mins grace so that if they do arrive at 09.30 that they can actually get somthing to eat. ..onto the room..as I had read on previous commend 'the room is small but for new york standards it's fine'.nothing could of surprised me more at how small that room was going to be..TINY!.Seriouly glad I only had to stay there 2 nights or we would of gone mad. I personally didn't even spend that much time in the hotel room but it's so small that it was a few hours too much.My sheets also had stains on them that reselembed blood stains..not impressed. location wise great but as I said that sometimes isn't enough. I personally wouldn't recommend to a friend due to the small room size.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Julliet1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here recently and found it a great hotel and location. It is fairly new (opened Nov. 2007) so it has modern furnishings, flat screen TV, safe in room, mirco and fridge. (The fridge was not plugged in so it did not get cold enough later that evening for us to use it). Rooms are very tiny (guessing they are 12 x 12) with a tiny bathroom but we have found them all to be small in NY City. Location is great and about 10 min walk to Rockerfeller Ctr and St. Patrick's Cathedral. Short distance (about 10 min) to theatre district and Times Square. Hotel staff were very nice and accommodating when my reservation had an issue. The free breakfast is in the basement floor and very small. Had bagels, oatmeal, cereal but would not let you make your own waffles as the server made them herself which I had never seen before. Not much space to sit down there so we took the food up to the room (brought the tray from the room with us). This one is much nicer than the other Comfort Inn in Times Square which is just as small but not as modern. We would definitely stay here again and are planning to return. By the way, if you drive in, they validate your parking which will cost you $40. Do yourself a favor and go online before coming and get a coupon from the Central Parking Garage on W 38th street. We got an internet coupon for $25 for 24 hour parking there which was a deal for NY City. Again - this garage will take you about 10 mins to walk there.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected”
Reviews.Author: alainag
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a 2 night stay and definitely expected more. Being New York I expected the room to be small and that it was! There was no room to put our luggage and no dresser to store anything. The king size bed was very big and comfortable until we found a bug crawling around our pillows. The bathroom is decent sized but somehow water would leak huge puddles onto the floor after every shower. Continental breakfast is provided but when I walked down there at 9:15 then were putting everything away & I was not "allowed" to get anything even though breakfast was supposed to be served until 9:30. On a positive note, the location is ideal. We were able to walk everywhere including Times Square, Fifth Avenue, even to Central Park! Overall, close in distance but would not stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Very dangerous shower and no counter in the bathroom to put anything”
Reviews.Author: Nana&Boppa
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and expected much more after reading other reviews. I did expect the VERY SMALL room but I did not expect the bathroom situation. There was absolutely no counter in the bathroom and the toilet had a sloped lid so nothing even stayed on top of that. We had to carry toiletries back & forth while trying to balance them on the sink. Also the walk in shower did not drain away from the floor and the floor was very wet after each shower and I slipped and almost fell untill I finally got enough towels to put all over the floor. Up to that point it was 2 towel, 2 washcloths, 2 hand towels - no extras. Also on the first day I was pleased to receive the newspaper as usual but we were off to an early start so I left it unopened on the dresser expecting to read it upon our return only to find it gone. When I complained at the front desk I was told they would get me one - never happened. For the next 2 days I never received a newspaper and after requesting one from the front desk was told they would get me one from the store - never happened. I asked 3 times and when I saw one on the counter was told it was for another customer! My biggest surprise was when I looked at my bill only to find out I had been overcharged from what I was quoted on my reservation. After I emailed them a copy of my reservation showing the lower price they sent a new bill and only time will tell if my credit card is charged the correct amount. This motel is clean and very close to everything and we were able to walk or take a short taxi ride where we wanted to go. The front desk people need to do a better job of assisting customers.

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money in the heart of New York”
Reviews.Author: Rorycake
Reviews.Content: Just back from a four night stay in the Comfort Inn. Check in was smooth with friendly staff. As others have said previously, rooms are a bit on the small side but then again you don't go to New York to spend time in your room. The location is ideal, just a few blocks from Times Square, Macy's, Empire State Building etc. The hotel is also just around the corner from the Port Authority bus station - perfect if you want to use the airport express bus. The breakfast room is tiny but we always managed to find a table. Breakfast consists of the usual - cereals, breads, cakes and waffles. The room was clean with towels and linen changed daily. Only problem we had was trying to figure out how to work the shower - a quick visit to reception and we had the answer. There is some building work on a skyscaper next door but nothing that would cause too much disturbance. We would certainly stay in this hotel again should we return to NYC especially for the price we paid and its location.

Reviews.Title: “Just okay”
Reviews.Author: parker362
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Comfort Inn Time Square for 2 nights in May. When we got to the room the air conditioning was broken (would not turn off) so we were quickly moved to another room. The second room was in good working order. Please note that the rooms are quite small though, even for NY standards. The only reason I mention this is because there was barely any room to put our luggage anywhere! The area also definitely has some "grit" on it. Not as nice as other parts of NY. Location was close to subway lines and attractions though. Only other complaint is that the stairwell gets used a lot in this hotel and since there are only 4 rooms per floor you constantly hear the stairwell door slamming. They offered a continental breakfast which was nice. Room and hotel were just okay.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable in the heart of Times Square - and so nice!”
Reviews.Author: STLgogirl
Reviews.Content: They were SO nice. I had a group of students with me. We arrived at 10 am, and we just wanted them to hold our bags, but they checked us into our rooms. How nice! The rooms are small but they've made great use of the space, everything fits. The location was great, close walk to Times Square lights, and close to the subway. Smoke-free and they do a good job of that too. The only thing is if you use the safe, they charge for that, and add on a charity charge too.

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel ticks ALL the boxes”
Reviews.Author: Kat-astrophic
Reviews.Content: I had a short stay over in New York en-route to Orlando, Florida with my two daughters, sister and one daughters boyfriend, and cannot fault this hotel, it's amenities and the staff. On arrival we were greeted with big smiles and very pleasant front desk staff who gave us maps and information before we even got to our rooms. They informed us of the free breakfast and times as well as the services of the concierge. We had two rooms booked and though I did not visit my daughter and her boyfriends room, I was more than happy with my own, but was informed that their room was the same. The beds were very clean and comfortable. We had free newspaper, tea/coffee for machine and bottled water every day as well as the use of a free in room safe to keep our valuables in. The free breakfast was plentiful and delicious. I would strongly recommend you try the waffles. Though the dining area is on the small side, if you go early you can just walk straight to a table. It is only if you go a bit later at about 9.00am that you may have to waite for a table. The Concierge's could not have been more helpful. Concierge Katrina went out of her way to assist me in obtaining addresses for places we wanted to go to and wrote everything down so we could take it with us. Directions, information, telephoning to confirm pick up for transport back to airport, nothing was too much trouble. In fact, nothing was too much trouble for anyone working at the Comfort Inn. If I go back to New York, which I hope I do, I would have no hesitation in using this hotel once more.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC LOCATION....GREAT HOTEL.”
Reviews.Author: ramagemko
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Comfort Inn from Apr 4th to the 8th. They were fantastic...our fight got in really early in the morning so they let us leave our luggage and explore. We also flew out late and they did the same. The rooms were small but what do you really need??? By the time you get home you are exhausted from all the walking. The beds were comfy and there is a fridge and microwave which is nice. They also give you free water each day. All the staff was fantastic and the concierge was helpful. We have a great stay....New York is a fabulous city. This hotels is minutes from Madison Square Gardens, Times Square, Penn Station and Port Authority. It is easy to get anywhere in this City from this hotel. I would recommend this place to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “iPod went "missing"”
Reviews.Author: alancosworth
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Comfort Inn from the 13th to 18th march, Location was good, Rooms and bathrooms were clean. We had 2 twin rooms booked (4 males) and when we arrived they had 1 twin room and 1 double so i had to share a double bed with my mate for a couple of nights!! They did move us to a twin room after 2 nights. This is when my iPod went missing in the hotel. It was left on the ipod dock in the room and when i reported it missing a member of staff went back to the room and it wasn't there!! I emailed the hotel when i got home to see if it turned up and i got no reply!!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service and value for our large group”
Reviews.Author: jensena78
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent traveler but have never left a review for a hotel. Until now I have not been impressed or disappointed enough to take the time to write a review. We brought a large school group to the Comfort Inn Times square and had an absolutely fantastic time. We had a total of 52 people and took up 14 rooms so you could consider this review multiplied by 14. The hotel location is so close to Times Square and the subway that we had 2 senior citizens with us and they were happy with how close everything was. The rooms look exactly like their picture and for a New York hotel are actually bigger than most i have seen. The continental breakfast accommodated our large group and was a huge benefit for both a good breakfast and saving money in New York. They don't have a fitness center or a pool but who wants that when you are in New York? Get out and see the city. All things aside the best thing about this hotel was the staff. New Yorkers are not known for being friendly which we saw in the streets asking for directions, but this hotel's staff went above and beyond what would even be considered hospitable. Not only were they friendly and helpful with directions but they had everything ready for us when we arrived at 7:30 AM. We needed a place to put our bags and they allowed us to leave them there and even let some of the group check in to the available rooms. I would and already have recommended this hotel to friends and co-workers. When I return to New York, whether with just my family or with a large group, I will be staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Comfortable and Convienent!”
Reviews.Author: Pam64
Reviews.Content: I spent President's Day weekend in NYC and loved the Comfort Inn Times Square! The room are small but really do you go to NYC to stay in a room! The location is FABULOUS!!!!!!! Yes, the breakfast area is tiny but people were really nice and things moved along very well. I would stay there again and plan to do so!

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable Value for Location”
Reviews.Author: traveler1680
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during MLK weekend in January to celebrate a birthday. Booked through Hotels.com, the total for 3 nights was about $350. It's normally that much for one night in Times Square! The hotel is at 39th and 8th, only a few short blocks to the heart of Times Square, Macy's Herald Square and Penn Station. I asked the front desk for a room with a view and while no room has a direct view of the Square, we stayed on the 16th floor and had an awesome view of the New York Times building! The room was small, but the bathroom was actually quite spacious. Rooms are very tastefully decorated and the beds are comfy. I read the other comments about the front desk staff and couldn't disagree more. Sure, the front desk area is quite small and got a bit crazy at times, but if you are willing to be patient and offer a smile, the staff will go out of their way to help you. Overall, this hotel is an absolutely unbeatable value!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: loopy_rari
Reviews.Content: As most people have already said the rooms in the hotel are small but they are comfortable. We had enough room for 2 medium suitcases and a large holdall. The bed was very comfy and bathroom was clean, the towels were changed everyday. Housekeeping left two bottles of water in the room everyday. The hotel itself was fine it was very clean. We never had any problems during our 4 day stay. The breakfast area is small but we didn't have to wait for a table because we were always downstairs by 7.30am. The hotel staff were pleasant. The only bad experience we had was the conceiage iwe asked her if she could phone to reconfirm our transfer to the airport she was uninterested and clueless! It took her 15 minutes to understand that we already had a transfer booked but we had to confirm the departure time. It's probably because she wasn't listening to what we were saying. We weren't the only people who had trouble talking to her! We were unlucky that when we needed a conceiage we spoke to this lady. There was a more helpful conceiage on our first two days at the hotel she gave directions to places we wanted to see. The location is great in walking distance to port authority it's practically next door, Times Square is around a 10 minute walk. madison square garden is close by. Empire State Building is a 15 minute walk. We Walked to 5th Ave which took around 20 minutes. If you want to get good bargains you have to go to Woodbury Common you can book tickets from Port Authority Bus Station. Century 21 (opposite ground zero) also had great offers.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, I recommend”
Reviews.Author: felipeld
Reviews.Content: I had a good time with my family at this hotel. My parents decided to visit me in the US and we spent a few days in NYC. The Hotel is very well located in Times Square/Manhattan. Everything in Manhattan is walk distance from the hotel. If you think you are too far to walk, you can find many cabs and subway stations around. The staff are ok, and the breakfast very good. The price is a little expensive but you pay for what you get. Rooms are not that big but very clean, and comfortable, with nice decoration. I wouldn't hesitate to stay there another time.

Reviews.Title: “Times Square's Little Secret!”
Reviews.Author: NJGalFLGuy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is brand, spanking new which is rare to find in mid town Manhattan. The rooms are small but well equipped and comfortable. We had a double room which was beautifully decorated in a mod style with a wall unit, closet, drawers LCD TV and marble and tile bath. It was luxury in miniature. There are less than 80 rooms in this little slice of a high rise. The hotel staff is so helpful complete with concierge service and continental breakfast with hot waffles and a staff member who even makes them for you! If they cannotg get you into your room for early check-in, they are happy to hold your bags for you while you enjoy the city. The sheets were crisp and clean, pillows plump. I have stayed at many Manhattan hotels that are old and falling down with no room to walk around the bed - not so at this Comfort Inn. We felt safe and secure. If you are going to NY look no further. Great location. Close to Penn Station, Subway and Times Square and Broadway.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient and clean”
Reviews.Author: JordanMarsh
Reviews.Content: Yes, small rooms but who cares! We needed a room to sleep and shower. It was wonderful having a continental breakfast so that we could go down and wait while the others got ready. This hotel is walking distance from the Empire State Building, Times Square, Bryant Park, etc. Would recommend this and would plan to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Be prepared”
Reviews.Author: LizSomerset
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our trip to New York. Though we would return we would never stay at this hotel again. The rooms were good value for money, clean and comfortable. Within the room there was large TV, coffee and tea making facilities, good lighting and a very clean bath room. Towls were changed every day along with shampoo soap ect. The breakfast was an added extra and free. However the reception staff were unintrested in anything. The concierge ( 2 of them) didnt seem to have any knowledge of the area or the attractions available. She had plenty of trips that you could book, but if you wanted to get anywhere by your own steam she didnt have a clue how to get there. Nor how you could find out. At on point I asked her could she look it up on the laptop in front of her to get the required info. As I say the hotel was good value but dont expect anyone to give you the thumbs up on anything I can assure you will be on your own. So do your homework at home dont bother asking for any assistance cos you will get none. Had they taken 5 minutes to give us directions it would have made a hugh difference. We went to the New Yorker up 8th to get basic info on standard info. Though as I say the hotel was value, the service within was nil. There was a helpful gentleman on reception who gave us some info after we had asked and been blanked by the Conierge. Prior to travelling we had pre booked and paid for a private car to collect us from the airport. It didnt turn up so we called the number the number on the reciept. Didnt exsist, so we called the hotel to see if they could help. I was told very curtly that it was nothing to do with the hotel. When we got to the hotel I spoke to them about the car and the company in New York who we had booked with. There respnse was take it up when you get back to England didnt even look or try to look it up for us on the internet. So as I say expect nothing and that way you will not be dissappointed in the lack of service.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value. Liked it a lot!”
Reviews.Author: Yair G
Reviews.Content: I needed a reasonably priced hotel for one night and chose this one after reading the good reviews here. I was not dissapointed! Although quiet small, the room was new and very comfortable. The storage space is minimal but for one person/one night that didn't bother me. For a longer stay this may be an issue. The staff and service were very welcoming and helpful. The breakfast area is small and crowded and you basically need to wait for your chance to great seat, but other than that the 'continental' breakfast is actually quiet rich and overall very good. The area - right next to the Port Authority bus terminal - is a bit shabby but the location is excellent, 2 minutes from the subway station and 10 minutes from the heart of Times Square. I got a very good rate of $188 for a queen room, and this includes the breakfast and free wi-fi internet. Actually when I made my reservation this rate was not available and I booked at a higher rate, but few days later on their own initiative they sent me an ammended reservation with the lower rate ! Overall this hotel is an excellent value and very recommended for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location Good Price”
Reviews.Author: Lookin4TheBeach
Reviews.Content: Something to note here....Size in pictures is VERY deceiving. The professional pictures taken by the hotel (on the hotel's website) were taken from the best possible angles to make this hotel seem much more spacious than it really is! But that is "Marketing" so you can't blame them, but I just want to prepare you. From the moment we stepped out of the cab we looked at that "GRAND-Looking Comfort Inn Sign" at the entrance and just laughed (you will too). The hotel literally looks like a tall skinny Match Stick going straight up into the sky. It is a NEW hotel and with space so limited in NYC it looks like they took a little alley, between two buildings and somehow squeezed this hotel into it. It is funny! The picture of the "breakfast buffet area" is hillarious. It looks so vast in the pictures...but wait til you see it, that is all I can say! The rooms are tiny too, but again it is NYC! Who cares about the room size - get out and see this great city! I don't want you to think I didn't like this hotel.... I LOVED it! Location is Great, the staff is friendly and helpful, the beds are soft and the room was clean and nice! I would stay here again and again. I am now just more prepared on how small everything really is! Bar next door is $10 cover charge and caters to a "certian lifestyle crowd" FYI, in case that is not your thing. One last note. Go out the hotel door and turn right, head a couple blocks down and you are in Hells Kitchen. If you are there on the weekends you may be lucky enough to hit the Hells Kitchen outdoor flea market, lots of great old stuff! Had a great time!!

Reviews.Title: “Seriously Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: bostonenglish
Reviews.Content: This was a great place to stay. Reasonably priced (split between 3 people) very clean, very comfortable with little surprises like an i-pod dock and digital alarm clock. Great as that particular weekend in NYC there was a tropical storm and it was good to know that we had a great room to come back to. Check in staff were very helpful and let us check in 2 hours early. Beds were really comfy and the shower was fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been better”
Reviews.Author: tk0306
Reviews.Content: This was just what I needed after touring america for four weeks. Yes the room was small but it had everything you needed and the location was just fantastic. The room was like new with a large plasma TV on the wall. I would not hesitate to book to stay here again. Although the road is a bit dark I felt safe walking the short distance to the square. The staff were very helpful aswell with booking transport to the airport and making sure there was enough breakfast out in the morning. Although the breakfast room could do with extending as I had to rush my food to let someone else sit down.

Reviews.Title: “Convenience, Cleanliness and Friendliness!”
Reviews.Author: RobertECroneJr
Reviews.Content: We made the reservations online for my birthday and were pleasantly surprised as to how central the hotel actually was. We rented a suite on the 20th (top) floor and were extremely happy with EVERY aspect of our two night stay. The suite was a little small, but still very nice for NYC standards. The hotel is brand new so everything was impeccable. The living room and bedroom both had flat screen tv's, there was plenty of storage space and there was an IPOD docking station on the radio/alarm clock (the only draw back about the room was the lack of space designated for luggage - i.e. luggage rack). The bedding was comfortable and the bathroom was very spacious. The staff (especially EVELYN) was so professional, knowledgeable and friendly and answered any and all questions wihout hesitation. As well, the concierge was always quick to find info and provide brochures, maps, etc., as needed. The hotel even provided a service to hold your luggage after checking out so you could still do stuff in the city without tugging your luggage along (perfect for late train or plane departures). I would DEFINITELY stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: gabbysmomva
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel because we were traveling with our dog and they were in a good location and accepted pets for a nominal fee. Late in the evening, while we were in the room, the dog started to bark hysterically and we saw that she was barking at a mouse! The management graciously comped our room, but two weeks after our trip....SCABIES. I would not recommend this hotel until they make some significant changes to their hygiene standards!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Break”
Reviews.Author: Maddie2006
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from New York and thanks to the Comfort Inn had a very good break. I am in my mid fifties, female and I was traveling alone, the Hotel is just on West 39th Street (a very quiet street) but just around the corner was 8th Avenue which was really busy and if your walked north you was soon in Times Square. I used public transport to get me to and from JFK and the station was also around the corner on 8th Avenue, the staff here were really helpful. The room was small as some others pointed out but how long are you in there? It was comfy, clean and very pleasant, the bed was very comfortable and you just melted into the pillows, I can't remember ever sleeping so well. During the first night I'd turned off the air conditioning and because of the time difference woke and heard a slight thudding noise which was obviously the club next door, I'm a very light sleeper but this didn't cause me any problems, even though I must add I was on the 12th floor. The room was cleaned every day and bottled water was provided, one day I had gone back early with a headache and put up the do not disturb sign, on this day a note was pushed under the door informing me that if I needed anything to ring reception. The staff at breakfast and reception I found very helpful and I would say the only draw back was the continental breakfast then I'm a big fan of a full English but it certainly saved me time and money. The only other down side was the extra taxes added to the bill it was about $40 extra a day so you will need to take this into account when booking.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location and clean”
Reviews.Author: littleaddo
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a good location - only a few blocks from Times Square and subways nearby. Is very clean and felt safe there when I was on my own for one night - good selection at breakfast (waffles were good!) but there needs to be more eating space. Rooms are also very small and not much room for 2 people's luggage, however we weren't there much during the day and the bed was really comfy! Only downfall was that my boyfriend had his ipod stolen from the room - fair enough he should have put it in the safe provided but for the money we paid we expected that our stuff would be safe - clearly not! Hotel gave us a free night but other than that were not very helpful. Would stay again but would not leave anything lying around!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Location - Great Beds - Nice Room”
Reviews.Author: mjohnson29550
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at Comfort Inn. The rooms were small, but very adequate and everything was in the right place. Two women on a shopping trip and we had ample space to store all of our goodies. There was a small safe in the room to store all of our personal items. The bed was the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in. The room had just been renovated and it was very nicely done. 32" flat panel TV was a huge plus! Would definitely stay again! Breakfast was great and the people were extra nice. Thanks for a great stay in the big apple!

Reviews.Title: “OK Hotel for a stay in New York”
Reviews.Author: JannikM
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Comfort Inn for 5 days in May 2008. We choose this hotel based on the location, the user reviews, the included breakfast and the price. The hotel is located very close to Times Square on 8 th avenue. Thus the location is good even though 8th avenue is a little gloomy at night. The Hotel is quite new, and the staff is friendly. All in all we we can recommend this hotel for a quick trip to NY. It is good value for money, but don't expect too much though. One thing you shouldn't choose this hotel for is the breakfast. That was simply a joke! If the breakfast had been better I would have given it 4.

Reviews.Title: “Good little modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: kb1977
Reviews.Content: The rooms are clean and modern, lovely big comfortable super king bed and 32" LCD TV on wall. Located 1 block from the subway for lines AC & E (literally a 1 minute walk) and also a block from the bus station. Didn't find the room too small at all, it was fine for what we needed. There is a coffee maker and ice bucket, no fridge and a pay safe. Reception will store your luggage securely on your last day. Breakfast was actually quite good - good coffee and they make fresh waffles for you, and if you can catch the breakfast room when its empty then even better, however there are only 14 seats in here and around 60 rooms so when full that could mean 120 people competing for 14 places!! We grabbed coffee/croissants some days and took them up to our room. The club next door is a latino club and is called Escuelita - really nothing to worry about and no noise heard. Had a great view of the New York Times building from our 15th floor room. Great location for Times Square, theatre district and 42nd Street, the hotel itself is in the Garment district, which is full of material shops/wholesalers. If you head up a few blocks to 46th street (between 8th and 9th ave) this street is full of nice restaurants which we didnt find until the last night - should have looked in our guide book sooner -much cheaper and better food than the ones on Broadway or around Times Square. Also Chevy's Fresh Mex Mexican on 42nd Street (between 7th and 8th) was a really good mexican - it looks like a chain restaurant but it was great and the staff were fantastic. Getting to JFK is really easy on the E line towards Jamaica ($2) - its really obvious where to get off and the airtrain ($5) comes every 2 minutes and couldn't be any easier. It takes just over an hour.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT value; nice little hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: MomInVa3
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very narrow...and sure, it's on a side street...but I always felt very safe and close to the hustle and bustle of 8th and the whole Times Square area. We were able to navigate from the hotel to subway stops, and walk to MOMA and Radio City...not too bad of a walk and so I felt the location-to-price ratio was very nice! The continental breakfast was often picked over, but you could always get coffee and some poptarts or cereal if you wished. The staff was lovely. I stayed with my 14 year old daughter and some other family members were on a different floor. We never heard any noise from other rooms or from the club. Our view was of the bus terminal, but who cares? The room was fine and the king bed was super comfortable. No bugs, no "issues." I would stay here again without reserve.

Reviews.Title: “Club Comfort Inn”
Reviews.Author: missed69
Reviews.Content: Well Hotel is average, usual wear and tear of a hotel, Room was tiny and was actually damp and musty it was almost 100 degrees outside, Furniture was chipped up blankets stained and YES the club next door it actually felt like the club was in the hotel you could hear the music and feel the vibration of the music Its in a ok location the building next door was condemend and looked like it was going to fall over same with the buildings across the street and actualy night club next doorthe lobby was tiny and also the breakfest area was tiny had to wait in line to get the food not enough places to sit, Is an average hotel hopefully the keep up with the wear and tear of the furniture and also the scrapes and dings on the walls in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Worst experience ever - would not recommend!!!!”
Reviews.Author: sUpErTrAveLLer888
Reviews.Content: This was my second time to New York and was indeed spolit by the poor service from the hotel staff. When we arrived we were greeted by the staff and the hotel had been booked and paid for in the UK before arrival. I was told that the room had NOT been reserved for us despite having a receipt to confirm this. Having showed them the receipt they then allocated us with a room. The room itself was small and not ideal for 3 females with suitcases, despite it being a 2x doublebed room. We were tripping over our suitcases throughout the stay! Not ideal! On day 2, after returning from a day out, we return to find we had been locked out of our room. We asked reception about this, who said it was an error and then reprogrammesd our key to let us in, 10 mins later they call to advise we have not paid our room and would have to pay again! I refuse and tell them to liaise with the booking agent as they had already taken payment. They refuse to make the call to the UK to resolve the problem and kept demanding for us to pay in full again! The manager himself was very cocky to say the least and very unhelpful. In the end, he calls the UK after standing there for 30mins demanding he speaks to the booking agent. The booking agent gives him company credit card details to pay for the hotel, but the manager refuses to take the details saying he needs it in writing and it MUST be faxed to him! This annoyed me to say the least as the booking agent was giving him details to make the payment! This ruined our whole evening worrying about whether this issue would be resolved. None of the staff members bothered to tell us the following morning that the whole issue had been resolved! I had to constantly ask and the answer I always got was - I dont know, someone else is dealing with this matter. I will get them to call you. Least to say this matter was between the booking agent and the hotel! We should not have been involved to this extent. Not only did this ruin our holiday, but we never even got an apology for all the hassles this has caused! I would never recommend anyone to stay in this hotel, the customer service is the worst I have ever experienced!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and very nice staff”
Reviews.Author: CaliMom05
Reviews.Content: Our family of six booked 2 rooms via the Choice Hotels website and stayed for 4 nights. After reading reviews on TripAdvisor we requested and obtained rooms on the 18th floor. Our beds were comfy and the rooms were a little tight but we only spend time in the rooms sleeping and getting ready for the next day. It was nice and quiet each night. Our kids were ages 8, 10, 20 and 23 with two adults and we all felt comfortable in the hotel. Breakfast was usually on the go, taking it up to our rooms or walking out with it on our way to the subway. The Port Authority subway stop is just a few blocks away - very convenient as the boys made a few trips to Yankee Stadium and the girls went shopping downtown. An easy walk to Times Square from the hotel as well as to see a Broadway show. If we get the opportunity to vist NYC again, we definitely would make this hotel our first choice.

Reviews.Title: “Decent but left stranded by the shuttle bus breakdown”
Reviews.Author: woosie9
Reviews.Content: we, a family of four from Singapore came to NYC for the first time. Stayed in the hotel from 9 to 12 Jun 2008. Being new ,it was nice and quiet on the 18th floor. Rooms were small. Breakfast included in the rates were ok and the staff in the breakfast room were helpful, but not the front desk who were not very friendly. We suffered a bad traumatic experience which i have to highlight here. We booked through the hotel Concierge and paid $64 ( Receipt J 14359 ) for a shuttle bus ( operated by Apple Commuter Company INC ) for 4 leaving at 5.25pm on 12 Jun to bring us to the JFK airport. Halfway the bus broke down and we were left stranded in the middle of the road. There were another dozen or so pax on the bus.The driver did not bother to help us or give any instructions as to how we could get to the airport.We had to wait for more than 30 mins before a private cab stopped to pick us to the airport. As it was near our departure time, the 30 mins wait was traumatic and very stressful for fear of missing the flight as we cannot afford a delay back home. We had to pay 3 times the normal fare demanded by the cab driver.We had to dash to check in and my wife fell and suffered bruises on the arms and legs herself. I have sent a email to the hotel asking for a refund of the shuttle fare and cab fare and compensation for duress and trauma suffered as a result of the breakdown of the Bus but to date I have received no response. Woo Seiw Cho Singapore

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay in Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: we_travel_lots
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from a long weekend in New York City and a stay at the Comfort Inn. The room was small but very comfortable. The king-size bed was amazing, possibly the most comfortable hotel bed that we have ever encountered! The staff was friendly and helpful. The breakfast selection was okay, but the breakfast room was extremely small and stuffy. We found it best to get some breakfast and take it back to our room. The location was a short walk to Times Square, but located on an “ugly” block of 39th Street. We never felt unsafe walking to the hotel at night, but it looked a little creepy. Overall, we enjoyed our stay at the Comfort Inn and I would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “We were pleased!”
Reviews.Author: sunitaparmar
Reviews.Content: this was a great hotel! The staff were excellent and hotel was very clean. The breakfast was super, it had everything but eggs and toast. I loved it! Location was good....we walked everywhere and never used public transport to see anything. There were decent restaurants nearby to grab a bite to eat. The bed was the best!! It was extremly comfortable. I would definitly recommend to my friends.

HotelInfo.Name: Comfort Inn Times Square South
HotelInfo.Address: 305 W 39th St, (39th St and 8th Ave), New York City, NY 10018
